original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa rnams la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who have not realized or have wrongly realized the selflessness of persons and phenomena, in order to teach the non-cessation of the selflessness of persons and phenomena,

original: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rab tu byed pa sum cu pa brtsams so //
translated: the thirty verses on cognition are composed.

original: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa'ang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gang zag dang chos la bdag med par bstan pa'ang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therein, the teaching on the selflessness of persons and phenomena is for the sake of abandoning the afflictive and cognitive obscurations,

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba las byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba las byung ngo //
translated: because in this way, the afflictions such as attachment arise from the view of self.

original: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas na de spangs na nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par khong du chud pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas na de spangs na nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the realization of the selflessness of persons is the antidote to the view of the transitory collection, when that is abandoned, all afflictions will be abandoned.

original: chos la bdag med par shes pa yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par shes pa yang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the knowledge that phenomena lack a self-entity is the antidote to the obscurations to omniscience, so it will eliminate the obscurations to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba yang thar pa dang thams cad mkhyen ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba yang thar pa dang thams cad mkhyen ba thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the elimination of the afflictive and the obscurations to omniscience is for the sake of attaining liberation and omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni thar pa 'thob pa la bsgribs pas de'i phyir de dag spangs na thar pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni thar pa 'thob pa la bsgribs pas de'i phyir de dag spangs na thar pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the afflictions obstruct the attainment of liberation, liberation is attained when they are eliminated.

original: shes bya'i sgrib ba ni shes bya thams cad la ye shes 'jug pa'i bar du gcod par gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib ba ni shes bya thams cad la ye shes 'jug pa'i bar du gcod par gyur pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: The obscurations to omniscience are non-afflicted ignorance that obstructs the entry of wisdom into all objects of knowledge.

original: de spangs na shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kun la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
analyzed: de spangs na shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kun la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug ste /
translated: When they are eliminated, wisdom enters all aspects of objects of knowledge without attachment and without obstruction.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is attained.

original: yang na chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag sems tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /üîΩde'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug @147a * //
analyzed: yang na chos dang gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag sems tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te / de'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bstan pas rnam par rig pa tsam 'bras bu dang bcas pa la mthar gyis 'jug @147a * //
translated: Or else, those who are attached to the person and the dharmas do not know the mind only as it really is.

original: par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
translated: Therefore, in order to introduce them gradually to the mind only together with its result, by teaching them the selflessness of the person and the selflessness of the dharmas, this chapter is begun.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes bya yang rdzas nyid du kha cig sems pa dang / gzhan dag shes bya bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob nyid du yod kyi don dam par ni med do snyam du sems pa mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis dgag pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa bzhin du shes bya yang rdzas nyid du kha cig sems pa dang / gzhan dag shes bya bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob nyid du yod kyi don dam par ni med do snyam du sems pa mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di rnam pa gnyis dgag pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
translated: Or else, this chapter is begun in order to refute the two extremes: some think that the object of cognition is substantial like consciousness, while others think that consciousness exists only superficially, like the object of cognition, and does not exist ultimately.

original: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //üîΩsna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa // sna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
translated: The various designations of self and dharmas

original: 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang bstan bcos la'o //
translated: arise in the world and in the treatises.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the verse.

original: de ni rnam par shes par gyur //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes par gyur //
translated: It is the transformation of consciousness.

original: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa //
translated: The designation of self and phenomena

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //üîΩbdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pas /
translated: is to be supplied.üîΩThe designation of self and phenomena

original: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang chos su nyer 'dogs pa ste /
translated: is the designation of self and phenomena.

original: de yang bdag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the designation of self and the designation of phenomena.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: Various means many kinds.

original: bdag dang srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / de dag la sogs pa dag ni bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu dang / de dag la sogs pa dag ni bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The designation of self refers to such things as self, life-force, one who is born, one who is nourished, one who grows, and so on.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de dag la sogs pa dag ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang / gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de dag la sogs pa dag ni chos su nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The designation of phenomena refers to such things as aggregates, elements, sense bases, form, feeling, conception, volitional factors, consciousness, and so on.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa 'di rnams gnyis ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa 'di rnams gnyis ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa nyid de /
translated: These two designations are the transformation of consciousness.

original: bdag gam chos rnams dngos po la nye bar 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhen chos rnams dang / bdag ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa las phyi rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gam chos rnams dngos po la nye bar 'dogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhen chos rnams dang / bdag ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa las phyi rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that the self or phenomena are superimposed on things.

original: gyur zhes bya ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gyur zhes bya ba de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is a transformation.

original: rgyu'i skad cig 'gag pa dang / dus mnyam du rgyu'i skad cig dang mi 'bral ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thob pa ni gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig 'gag pa dang / dus mnyam du rgyu'i skad cig dang mi 'bral ba 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thob pa ni gyur pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the causal moment and the attainment of the nature of the effect, which is not separate from the causal moment, is a transformation.

original: de la bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su brtas shing gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su brtas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bdag la sogs par snang ba dang / gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su brtas shing gzugs la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su brtas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las bdag la sogs par snang ba dang / gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When the latent impressions of the conception of a self, etc., and the latent impressions of the conception of form, etc., are fully developed, the conception of the appearance of a self, etc., and the conception of the appearance of form, etc., arise from the store consciousness.

original: de la bdag la sogs par snang ba dang / gzugs la sogs par snang ba yang phyi rol gyi bdag dang / @147b chos rnams med par rnam par rtog pa de las phyi rol du gyur pa lta bu rgyur byas nas /
analyzed: de la bdag la sogs par snang ba dang / gzugs la sogs par snang ba yang phyi rol gyi bdag dang / @147b chos rnams med par rnam par rtog pa de las phyi rol du gyur pa lta bu rgyur byas nas /
translated: The appearance as self, etc. and the appearance as form, etc. are imputed as self, etc. and as form, etc. in dependence upon the conception of external selves and phenomena, which are non-existent as external.

original: bdag la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su nye bar 'dogs pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: bdag la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos su nye bar 'dogs pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug ste /
translated: The imputation of self, etc. and the imputation of form, etc. as phenomena have been in operation since beginningless time.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the seeing of floating hairs, etc. by one with an eye disease.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gang med pa de la de nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gang med pa de la de nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: The so-called imputation is the imputation of something to something else where it does not exist.

original: dper na mi blun po la ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi blun po la ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like calling a stupid man ‚Äúan ox.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / phyi rol na yang bdag dang chos rnams med pas bdag dang chos rnams kun du brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / phyi rol na yang bdag dang chos rnams med pas bdag dang chos rnams kun du brtags pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, since the nature of consciousness and external selves and phenomena do not exist, selves and phenomena are only imagined.

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin pas shes bya yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du rdzas nyid do zhes mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di khas mi blang ngo //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin pas shes bya yang rnam par shes pa bzhin du rdzas nyid do zhes mtha' gcig tu smra ba 'di khas mi blang ngo //
translated: Since it does not exist ultimately, consciousness is not a substance, just like the object of consciousness.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa ni gzhi med par mi srid pas gang la bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa gyur pa dngos po yod par nges nga ra khas blang ngo //
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa ni gzhi med par mi srid pas gang la bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa gyur pa dngos po yod par nges nga ra khas blang ngo //
translated: Since designation is not possible without a basis, we must accept that the consciousness that is the basis for the designation of self and phenomena is a real entity.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa yang shes bya bzhin du kun rdzob nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa yang shes bya bzhin du kun rdzob nyid de /
translated: Therefore, just like the object of consciousness, consciousness is a conventional truth.

original: don dam par med do zhes khas len pa des rigs pa mi bzod de /
analyzed: don dam par med do zhes khas len pa des rigs pa mi bzod de /
translated: It is not tenable to accept that it does not exist ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu yang dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be a thing that does not exist even conventionally.

original: rten med na kun rdzob du mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: rten med na kun rdzob du mi rung ba ste /
translated: Without a basis, the conventional is not possible.

original: de bas na mtha' gcig tu smra ba rnam pa 'di gnyis yang mi rigs pa'i phyir btang ngo zhes slob dpon gyi tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na mtha' gcig tu smra ba rnam pa 'di gnyis yang mi rigs pa'i phyir btang ngo zhes slob dpon gyi tshig go //
translated: Therefore, because both of these extreme assertions are untenable, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna said, ‚ÄúBoth are rejected.‚Äù

original: de ltar na shes bya thams cad kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po med do //
analyzed: de ltar na shes bya thams cad kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po med do //
translated: Thus, since all objects of knowledge are the imagined reality, they do not exist as things.

original: rnam par shes ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas rdzas su yod par khas blang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas rdzas su yod par khas blang ngo //
translated: Consciousness is accepted as substantially existent because it is dependently arisen.

original: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni gyur ba'i sgras bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni gyur ba'i sgras bstan pa'o //
translated: The dependent origination of consciousness is indicated by the term transformation.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par 'byung ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhe na /üîΩphyi rol gyi don ni bdag snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'dod kyi byed rgyu tsam du 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa nyid don gyi rnam par 'byung ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhe na / phyi rol gyi don ni bdag snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du 'dod kyi byed rgyu tsam du 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: How can it be known that consciousness itself arises in the aspect of an object without external objects?

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dang bye brag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dang bye brag med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: External objects are asserted to be the objective condition of consciousness because they generate consciousness that appears as them. They are not asserted to be merely the causal condition because they would be no different from the immediately preceding condition and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni ba bstsags pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni ba bstsags pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The five collections of consciousness have as their objective domain a collection of subtle particles.

original: de'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbstsags pa ni cha @148a * //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro // bstsags pa ni cha @148a * //
translated: because it resembles the aspect of that.

original: shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na med de /
analyzed: shas 'dus pa tsam las gud na med de /
translated: The accumulation is not separate from the mere collection of parts.

original: cha shas de dag brtsal na bstsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas de dag brtsal na bstsags pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when those parts are sought, the consciousness of the aspect of the accumulation does not exist.

original: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa bstsags pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol gyi don med par rnam par shes pa bstsags pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, without external objects, consciousness arises in the aspect of an accumulation.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa dag nyid ni rdul phra rab dag ni de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa dag nyid ni rdul phra rab dag ni de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere collection of atoms does not have the aspect of that.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ma bstsags pa'i dus na yang rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur ba ci yang med de /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ma bstsags pa'i dus na yang rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur ba ci yang med de /
translated: Even when the atoms are not accumulated, there is no change in their nature at all.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams ma bstsags pa bzhin du bstsags pa yang dmigs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab rnams ma bstsags pa bzhin du bstsags pa yang dmigs par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, like the atoms when they are not accumulated, the accumulation is also not suitable to be an object.

original: gzhan dag rdul phra rab re re gzhan la mi ltos pa ni dbang pos mi rtogs kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag rdul phra rab re re gzhan la mi ltos pa ni dbang pos mi rtogs kyi /
translated: Others say: Each atom does not depend on another, and the sense faculty does not apprehend it.

original: dbang po phan tshun ltos pa ni dbang pos bzung ba'o snyam du sems pa de dag gi yang ltos pa dang mi ltos pa'i dus na rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pas dbang pos gzung ba'am /
analyzed: dbang po phan tshun ltos pa ni dbang pos bzung ba'o snyam du sems pa de dag gi yang ltos pa dang mi ltos pa'i dus na rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pas dbang pos gzung ba'am /
translated: The mutual dependence of the sense faculties is the apprehension of the sense faculties.

original: dbang pos mi rtogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang pos mi rtogs pa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: But since there is no difference in their nature when they are dependent or not dependent, they would be either apprehended by the sense faculties or not apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur du zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun ltos pa'i rdul phra rab nyid rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur du zin na ni /
translated: If the subtle atoms themselves, which are mutually dependent, were to become the object of consciousness,

original: de lta na bum pa dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa la 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na bum pa dang rtsig pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa la 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the various aspects of a pot, a wall, etc. would not appear in consciousness,

original: rdul phra rab dag de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag de'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subtle atoms are not of that aspect.

original: rnam par shes pa la snang ba yang gzhan la yul yang rnam pa gzhan du ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la snang ba yang gzhan la yul yang rnam pa gzhan du ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that what appears in consciousness is one thing and the object is another, because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: rdul phra rab dag kyang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha yod pas ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag kyang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha yod pas ka ba la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since the atoms have parts, such as a front side and a back side, they are not ultimately real, like pillars and so on.

original: de ni khas mi len na ni rdul phra rab la shar dang / lho dang / nub dang ; byang la sogs pa'i phyogs tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni khas mi len na ni rdul phra rab la shar dang / lho dang / nub dang ; byang la sogs pa'i phyogs tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept this, then the atom will not have different parts, such as an eastern side and a southern side, and so on.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang lus pa med pa dang / yul na mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin du rdul phra rab kyang lus pa med pa dang / yul na mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like consciousness, the atom will not be located in a particular place and will not be composed of parts.

original: de lta na 'o na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid don gyis rnam par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid don gyis rnam par 'byung ste /
translated: If this is so, then, because external objects do not exist, consciousness itself appears as an object.

original: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par khas blang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par khas blang ngo //
translated: We accept this, just as in a dream consciousness arises without an object.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni de'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, past and future feelings and so on do not produce consciousness having their aspect,

original: 'gag pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have ceased or have not yet arisen.

original: da ltar gyi dag kyang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dag kyang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor do past and present ones generate present consciousness,

original: skye ba'i @148b tshe na ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i @148b tshe na ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist at the time of arising.

original: skyes pa'i tshe na ni rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i phyir bya ba cung zad kyang med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du skye'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i tshe na ni rnam par shes pa yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i phyir bya ba cung zad kyang med pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa nyid du skye'o //
translated: When consciousness has already arisen, it is consciousness of that object, so the mental consciousness arises without an object.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag dang chos dmigs su med na nya bar 'dogs par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag dang chos dmigs su med na nya bar 'dogs par mi rung ste /
translated: Others say: If the self and phenomena are not objects, designation is impossible.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa ni gsum yod na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa ni gsum yod na 'gyur gyi /
translated: Designation occurs when three factors are present:

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med na mi 'gyur te /
translated: if any one is absent, it does not occur.

original: don gyi dngos dang / de dang 'dra ba'i yul gzhan dang / de gnyi ga dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: don gyi dngos dang / de dang 'dra ba'i yul gzhan dang / de gnyi ga dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The three factors are the actual object, another object similar to it, and both of those.

original: dper na don gyi dngos me dang de dang 'dra ba bram ze'i khye'u dang / de gnyi ga'i thun mong gi chos ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid yod na bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs par byed pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na don gyi dngos me dang de dang 'dra ba bram ze'i khye'u dang / de gnyi ga'i thun mong gi chos ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid yod na bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs par byed pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, when the real object, fire, and the boy of the Brahmin caste, which is similar to it, and the common property of both of them, such as its being hot or sharp, exist, one figuratively applies the fire to the boy of the Brahmin caste.

original: 'di la bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs pa ni /üîΩrigs ma rdzas shig nye bar 'dogs grang na nye bar 'dogs pa gnyi ga yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar 'dogs pa ni / rigs ma rdzas shig nye bar 'dogs grang na nye bar 'dogs pa gnyi ga yang med do //
translated: In this case, the figurative application of fire to the boy of the Brahmin casteüîΩis either the figurative application of a substance to a class or the figurative application of a class to a substance. But neither figurative application exists.

original: de la re zhig thun mong gi chos ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid ni me'i rigs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig thun mong gi chos ser ba nyid dam rno ba nyid ni me'i rigs kyis ma yin no //
translated: First, the common property of being hot or sharp is not a class of fire.

original: thun mong gi chos med par bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos med par bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: Without a common property, it is not possible to figuratively apply a class to a boy of the Brahmin caste,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: rigs chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid rigs med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rigs chos de gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin yang rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid rigs med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even though the two properties of caste and religion do not exist in the Brahmin boy, sharpness and yellowness do not occur without a caste, so caste is imputed to the Brahmin boy.

original: rigs med par yang rno ba nyid dang / ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u la mthong ba'i phyir med par mi 'byung ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs med par yang rno ba nyid dang / ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u la mthong ba'i phyir med par mi 'byung ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since sharpness and yellowness are seen in the Brahmin boy even without a caste, it is not reasonable that they do not occur without a caste.

original: med par mi 'byung ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa la med de /
analyzed: med par mi 'byung ba ni nye bar 'dogs pa la med de /
translated: The non-occurrence of something does not exist in imputation.

original: me bzhin du bram ze'i khye'u la yang rigs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me bzhin du bram ze'i khye'u la yang rigs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because caste exists in the Brahmin boy, just as fire does.

original: de bas na bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na bram ze'i khye'u la rigs nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to impute caste to the Brahmin boy.

original: rdzas su nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: rdzas su nye bar gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: It is not reasonable to impute substance,

original: spyi'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the property of generality does not exist.

original: me'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de nyid ni bram ze'i khye'u la med do //
analyzed: me'i yon tan rno ba'am ser ba gang yin pa de nyid ni bram ze'i khye'u la med do //
translated: The sharpness or yellowness of the property of fire does not exist in the Brahmin boy.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de de las gzhan te /
analyzed: de de las gzhan te /
translated: Because he is different from that.

original: bye brag ni rang gi gnas dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag ni rang gi gnas dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The particular is related to its own location.

original: me'i yon tan med par bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar gdags pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: me'i yon tan med par bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar gdags pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not correct to apply fire to the Brahmin boy without the qualities of fire.

original: gal te me'i yon tan dang 'dra bas rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te me'i yon tan dang 'dra bas rigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is correct because it is similar to the qualities of fire,

original: de ltar na yang 'dra ba'i phyir me'i yon tan rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba nyid dang ser ba @149a * //üîΩnyid la nye bar gdags su ni rung gi //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'dra ba'i phyir me'i yon tan rno ba nyid dang ser ba nyid bram ze'i khye'u'i yon tan rno ba nyid dang ser ba @149a * // nyid la nye bar gdags su ni rung gi //
translated: then because of the similarity, the qualities of fire, sharpness and yellowness, are correct to apply to the qualities of the Brahmin boy, sharpness and yellowness.

original: yon tan 'dra bas bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar gdags su ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'dra bas bram ze'i khye'u la me nye bar gdags su ni mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not correct to apply fire to the Brahmin boy because of the similarity of qualities.

original: me na yon tan gyi 'dra ba dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me na yon tan gyi 'dra ba dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fire is not related to the similarity of qualities.

original: de lta bas na rdzas nye bar gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzas nye bar gdags su yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to apply substance either.

original: don gyi dngos kyang med de /
analyzed: don gyi dngos kyang med de /
translated: There is also no real object,

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo ni shes pa dang brjod pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its own nature is beyond the domain of all cognition and expression.

original: gtso bo la shes pa dang brjod pa yon tan gyi tshul gyis 'jug par zad de /
analyzed: gtso bo la shes pa dang brjod pa yon tan gyi tshul gyis 'jug par zad de /
translated: The cognition and expression of the principal are only engaged in the manner of a quality.

original: de'i rang rang gi ngo bo la ni mi reg go //
analyzed: de'i rang rang gi ngo bo la ni mi reg go //
translated: They do not touch the intrinsic reality of the principal itself.

original: gzhan du na yon tan don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yon tan don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the quality would be pointless.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa ma gtogs par don gyi dngos kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan med pas de'i phyir gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul la shes pa dang brjod pa med pas don gyi dngos po med par khong du chud par
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa ma gtogs par don gyi dngos kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i thabs gzhan med pas de'i phyir gtso bo'i rang gi ngo bo'i yul la shes pa dang brjod pa med pas don gyi dngos po med par khong du chud par
translated: Since there is no other means of ascertaining the intrinsic reality of the actual object except cognition and expression, therefore, one should understand that the actual object does not exist because cognition and expression do not exist in the domain of the intrinsic reality of the principal.

original: bya'o // de bzhin du sgra'i bar du 'brel ba med par shes pa dang / brjod pa med pa yang med do //
analyzed: bya'o // de bzhin du sgra'i bar du 'brel ba med par shes pa dang / brjod pa med pa yang med do //
translated: Similarly, up to sound, there is no cognition and expression without a connection.

original: de ltar na brjod ba dang brjod par bya ba med pas don gyi dngos po med do //
analyzed: de ltar na brjod ba dang brjod par bya ba med pas don gyi dngos po med do //
translated: Thus, since there is no expression and expressible object, the actual object does not exist.

original: yang 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa nyid de dngos ni med do //
analyzed: yang 'di dag thams cad ni btags pa nyid de dngos ni med do //
translated: Moreover, all of this is just a designation, but the actual [object] does not exist.

original: btags pa zhes bya ba ni gang med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: btags pa zhes bya ba ni gang med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa ste /
translated: What is called a designation is that which engages in the manner of non-existence.

original: sgra thams cad kyang gtso bo la med par btags pa'i ngo bos 'jug go //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyang gtso bo la med par btags pa'i ngo bos 'jug go //
translated: All words are applied by the nature of an imputation to the principal thing.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is indeed non-existent.

original: de la bdag dang chos su med na nye bar 'dogs pa mi rigs so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la bdag dang chos su med na nye bar 'dogs pa mi rigs so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, what was said, that if the self and phenomena do not exist, imputation is not reasonable, is unreasonable.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rab tu dbye ba yod pa mi shes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rab tu dbye ba yod pa mi shes te /
translated: One does not know the existence of the distinction in the transformation of consciousness.

original: de bas na de'i dbye ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gyur pa de yang rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i dbye ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir gyur pa de yang rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach its distinction, it is said: That transformation is threefold.

original: gang la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa dang / chos nye bar 'dogs pa de yang rgyu'i dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag nye bar 'dogs pa dang / chos nye bar 'dogs pa de yang rgyu'i dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tha dad pa'o //
translated: That to which the self is imputed and that to which phenomena are imputed are different in terms of cause and effect.

original: de la rgyur 'gyur ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyur 'gyur ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which becomes the cause is the increase of the habitual tendencies of karmic ripening and natural outflow in the store consciousness.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yongs su rdzogs la /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yongs su rdzogs la /
translated: That which becomes the effect is the completion of what was projected by past karma.

original: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid @149b kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'byung ba rnyed nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid @149b kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The maturation-impressions are the actualization of the store consciousness in other similar life-forms after they have been obtained. The natural impressions are the actualization of the actual consciousnesses and the afflicted consciousness from the store consciousness after they have been obtained.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags skyed do //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags skyed do //
translated: The actual consciousnesses, whether wholesome or unwholesome, generate the maturation-impressions and the natural impressions in the store consciousness.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid skyed do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags nyid skyed do //
translated: The afflicted consciousness, whether indeterminate or afflicted, generates only the natural impressions.

original: gyur pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa gang yin pa de yang mi shes nas /
analyzed: gyur pa rnam pa gsum bshad pa gang yin pa de yang mi shes nas /
translated: Since the three transformations that were mentioned above are not yet understood,üîΩin order to demonstrate their differentiation,

original: de bas na de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he says:

original: rnam par smin dang ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par smin dang ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The three transformations are called the ‚Äúmaturation,‚Äù the ‚Äúconceiver of I,‚Äù and the ‚Äúapprehender of objects.‚Äù

original: gyur pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang / ngar sems pa zhes bya ba dang / yul la rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa rnam pa gsum po de dag ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang / ngar sems pa zhes bya ba dang / yul la rnam par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three transformations are called the ‚Äúmaturation,‚Äù the ‚Äúconceiver of I,‚Äù and the ‚Äúapprehender of objects.‚Äù

original: de la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis ji ltar 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis ji ltar 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The maturation is the establishment of the result in accordance with the impetus of the maturation of the propensities of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rtag tu ngar sems pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ngar sems pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni rtag tu ngar sems pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ngar sems pa'o //
translated: The conceiver of I is the afflicted mind, because it always has the nature of conceiving I.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor snang bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug ni yul la rnam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul so sor snang bas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug ni yul la rnam par rig par bya'o //
translated: The apprehender of objects is the six consciousnesses of the eye, etc., because they are the individual appearances of objects such as form.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa med par de mi rtogs pas de bas na rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rim pa bzhin du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa med par de mi rtogs pas de bas na rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de rim pa bzhin du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since its own nature is not understood without explanation, therefore, in order to teach its nature in stages,üîΩhe says:

original: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni //
translated: The foundation consciousness

original: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: is the maturation of all seeds.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gang gyur pa rnam pa gsum bshad ma thag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gang gyur pa rnam pa gsum bshad ma thag pa la bya'o //
translated: There means in the just explained threefold transformation.

original: kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bya'o //
translated: Foundation consciousness means the foundation consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de rnam par smin par gyur pa'o //
translated: That consciousness is the maturation.

original: de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pas kun gzhi ste /
analyzed: de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pas kun gzhi ste /
translated: It is the foundation because it is the basis of the seeds of all afflicted phenomena.

original: kun gzhi dang rten zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi dang rten zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Foundation and basis are synonyms.

original: yang na de la chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel ba'am de chos thams cad la rgyu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel bas kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na de la chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel ba'am de chos thams cad la rgyu'i dngos por 'jug cing 'brel bas kun gzhi'o //
translated: Or else, it is the foundation because all dharmas are related to it as results, or it is the foundation because all dharmas are related to it as causes.

original: rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness because it causes the perception of objects.

original: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs thams cad du las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam bar smin pas rnam par smin pa'o //üîΩchos thams cad kyi sa bon @150a * //
analyzed: khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs thams cad du las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam bar smin pas rnam par smin pa'o // chos thams cad kyi sa bon @150a * //
translated: It is the maturation of all the elements, destinies, births, and families, through the maturation of good and bad actions.

original: gyi gnas yin pas sa bon thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: gyi gnas yin pas sa bon thams cad pa'o //
translated: It is the seed of all dharmas because it is the support of the seeds of all dharmas.üîΩIt is endowed with all the seeds because it is the seed of all dharmas.

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gud na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na go ba de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yang brjod dgos te /
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las gud na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na go ba de'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa yang brjod dgos te /
translated: If the store consciousness exists as a separate entity from the active forms of consciousness, then its object and mode of activity must be explained.

original: dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for consciousness to be without an object or mode of activity.

original: de dmigs pa med pa dang rnam pa med par ni mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: de dmigs pa med pa dang rnam pa med par ni mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: We do not maintain that it is without an object or mode of activity.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: However, the object and aspect are not fully differentiated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi nye bar len pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the store consciousness arises in two aspects: the internal appropriating consciousness and the external, undifferentiated aspect of the container world.

original: de la nang gi nye bar len ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi nye bar len ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming ste /
translated: The internal appropriation is the instinct for attachment to the imagined reality and the form of the sense faculties together with their bases.

original: de'i dmigs pa shin tu phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa shin tu phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its object is extremely subtle.

original: de ni len pa dag dang gnas //üîΩrnam par rig pa mi rig ste //
analyzed: de ni len pa dag dang gnas // rnam par rig pa mi rig ste //
translated: It is appropriation and the abode,üîΩbut it is not a discriminating consciousness.

original: gang la len pa mi rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa mi rig pa yod pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de len pa dang gnas kyi rnam par mi rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang la len pa mi rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa mi rig pa yod pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de len pa dang gnas kyi rnam par mi rig pa'o //
translated: Since there is no discrimination of appropriation and the abode, the store consciousness is not a discriminating consciousness.

original: de la len pa ni len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la len pa ni len par byed pa'o //
translated: Appropriation is that which appropriates.

original: de yang bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog ba'i bag chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de yang bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog ba'i bag chags dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags so //
translated: Moreover, it is the latent impressions of the conception of self, etc. and the latent impressions of the conception of form, etc.

original: de la yod pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs par rtog pa 'bras bur len pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags de ni len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs par rtog pa 'bras bur len pas bdag la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags de ni len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the alaya consciousness appropriates the results of the conceptions of self, etc. and form, etc., it is called appropriation.

original: de ni 'di la 'di'o zhes tshor ba'i rnam par mi rig pas de'i phyir de ni len pa mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di la 'di'o zhes tshor ba'i rnam par mi rig pas de'i phyir de ni len pa mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it does not cognize the feeling of this is here, it is called the noncognizant appropriation.

original: yang na gnas nye bar len pas len pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas nye bar len pas len pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, appropriation is the appropriation of the basis.

original: gnas ni lus so //
analyzed: gnas ni lus so //
translated: The basis is the body.

original: de yang gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming ngo //
analyzed: de yang gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po'i gzugs dang ming ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is the form of the sense faculties together with their bases, and name.

original: de'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: That which appropriates it is that which goes to it.

original: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len pa'o //
analyzed: de grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas len pa'o //
translated: Since it is the same as the attainment of pleasure, it is appropriating.

original: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni gnyi ga len to //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni gnyi ga len to //
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm, both are appropriated.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas gzugs med pa'i khams na ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas gzugs med pa'i khams na ni /
translated: But in the formless realm, because one is free from attachment to form,

original: gzugs su rnam par smin pa mi 'grub bas ming bzhi len pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs su rnam par smin pa mi 'grub bas ming bzhi len pa nyid de /
translated: only the four name aggregates are appropriated, since form is not actualized there.

original: 'on @150b kyang de na gzugs bag chags kyi dus nyid de /
analyzed: 'on @150b kyang de na gzugs bag chags kyi dus nyid de /
translated: However, in that realm, form is in the state of a latent impression,

original: rnam par smin pa'i dus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i dus ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the state of actualization.

original: len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas de'i phyir mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa de la 'di'o zhes rig par mi nus pas de'i phyir mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is not possible to know that appropriating in that realm is this or that, therefore it is called non-perceptive.

original: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa snod kyi 'jig rten gnas par rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par rig pa snod kyi 'jig rten gnas par rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The perceptual state of the world means the perceptual state of the world of the environment.

original: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung bas mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par 'byung bas mi rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And since that arises without a definite object and aspect, it is called non-perceptive.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su ma chad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su ma chad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: How can consciousness arise without a definite object and aspect?

original: 'di ni rnam par shes par smra ba ngag gi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes par smra ba ngag gi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus dang mtshungs so //
translated: This is the same as the time of the meditative attainment of cessation of speech for the Proponents of Consciousness.

original: 'gog pa la sogs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa med par rtog par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la sogs pa'i dus na rnam par shes pa med par rtog par yang mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to conceive of the absence of consciousness at the time of meditative attainment of cessation, etc.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba dang mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba dang mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would contradict reasoning and the s≈´tras.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni zhes smos pas rnam par shes pa ni nges par sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i phyir sems las byung ba gang dag yin pa dang / du zhig dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang bshad dgos la /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam shes ni zhes smos pas rnam par shes pa ni nges par sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i phyir sems las byung ba gang dag yin pa dang / du zhig dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang bshad dgos la /
translated: Since the root text says, ‚ÄúThe foundation consciousness,‚Äù it is certain that consciousness is concomitant with mental factors. Therefore, it must be explained which mental factors it is concomitant with and how many there are.

original: de bzhin du ci sems las byung ba de dag dang rtag tu mtshungs bar ldan nam /üîΩ'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci sems las byung ba de dag dang rtag tu mtshungs bar ldan nam / 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Similarly, it must be explained whether those mental factors are always concomitant with it.

original: de'i phyir / rtag tu reg dang yid byed dang // reg dang 'du shes sems par ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtag tu reg dang yid byed dang // reg dang 'du shes sems par ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text says, ‚ÄúIt is always concomitant with contact, mental engagement,üîΩfeeling, discrimination, and volition.‚Äù

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ji srid pa de srid du reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa zhes bya ba kun du 'gro ba'i chos lnga po 'di dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ji srid pa de srid du reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa zhes bya ba kun du 'gro ba'i chos lnga po 'di dag dang ldan no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means that as long as the foundation consciousness exists, these five omnipresent mental factors‚Äîcontact, mental activity, feeling, conceptualization, and volition‚Äîare associated with it.

original: reg pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Contact is the root of feeling.

original: de la reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ste /
analyzed: de la reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa ste /
translated: Among these, contact is the discriminator of the sense organ‚Äôs transformation that occurs when the three come together.

original: tshor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support feeling.

original: dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa gsum nyid gsum mo //
translated: The three are the sense organ, the object, and consciousness.

original: de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dus mnyam du gnas pa ni gsum 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dus mnyam du gnas pa ni gsum 'dus pa'o //
translated: When they exist simultaneously as cause and effect, they are called the ‚Äúthree coming together.‚Äù

original: de yod na de dang dus mnyam pa nyid na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa
analyzed: de yod na de dang dus mnyam pa nyid na bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa dbang po'i 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra ba bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul gyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa
translated: When that exists, at the very same time, the sense organ‚Äôs transformation that is compatible with the feeling of pleasure, etc., discriminates the aspect of the object that will experience the pleasure, etc.

original: de reg pa'o //
analyzed: de reg pa'o //
translated: That is contact.

original: dbang po dang bye brag gang gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'gyur ba'o //üîΩreg pa yang dbang po'i 'gyur pa dang 'dra bas dbang po'i reg @151a * //
analyzed: dbang po dang bye brag gang gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba de ni de'i 'gyur ba'o // reg pa yang dbang po'i 'gyur pa dang 'dra bas dbang po'i reg @151a * //
translated: The transformation of the faculty is the cause of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: pa'am / dbang bos reg pas reg ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'am / dbang bos reg pas reg ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Contact is similar to the transformation of the faculty, therefore it is called contact of the faculty, or contact by the faculty.

original: de'i phyir yul gyi 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gyi 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang dbang po'i 'gyur ba yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: Therefore, although it has the nature of discerning the transformation of the object, it is called discerning the transformation of the faculty.

original: 'di'i las ni tshor ba'i rten te /
analyzed: 'di'i las ni tshor ba'i rten te /
translated: Its action is the support of feeling.

original: de skad du mdo las kyang /üîΩbde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de skad du mdo las kyang / bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas /
translated: Thus, a scripture declares:üîΩ‚ÄúDependent on contact that is conducive to pleasure, the feeling of pleasure arises. ‚Äù

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And so on at length.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Mentality is the engagement of mind.

original: 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is engagement because it engages.

original: dmigs pa la gang gis sems mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la gang gis sems mngon du phyogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which the mind is directed toward the objective realm.

original: de ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to hold the mind to an object.

original: sems 'dzin ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la sems yang dang yang du gtod pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'dzin ba ni dmigs pa de nyid la sems yang dang yang du gtod pa'o //
translated: To hold the mind means to direct the mind again and again to that object.

original: las de yang sems kyi rgyun gyi dmigs pa nges par yid la byed par bye brag can gyi dbang du byas nas bshad kyi /
analyzed: las de yang sems kyi rgyun gyi dmigs pa nges par yid la byed par bye brag can gyi dbang du byas nas bshad kyi /
translated: This function is explained from the point of view of a special mental attention that determines the object of the mind continuum.

original: de sems kyi skad cig re re la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de sems kyi skad cig re re la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from the point of view of each moment of mind.

original: de ni skad cig re re nyid la las byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni skad cig re re nyid la las byed pa yin gyi /
translated: It functions in each moment,

original: skad cig gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in another moment.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Feeling has the nature of experience.

original: de yang yul sim par byed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa dang / de gnyi ga'i rnam pa las dben pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang yul sim par byed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa dang / de gnyi ga'i rnam pa las dben pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: It is threefold by the distinction of experiencing an object as agreeable, disagreeable, or neutral, which is to say, by the distinction of experiencing an object as having a nature that is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither of those two.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The following is thought:

original: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'dir myong bar byed pas myong ba ste /
analyzed: las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa 'dir myong bar byed pas myong ba ste /
translated: It is called experience because it experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de la bde ba myong ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba myong ba ni las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The experience of pleasure is the result of virtuous karma.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The experience of pain is the result of nonvirtuous karma.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong ba ni las dge mi dge gnyi ga'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong ba ni las dge mi dge gnyi ga'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: The experience of neither pleasure nor pain is the result of both virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: 'dir kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa nyid las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / don dam bar na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i btang snyoms nyid las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa nyid las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa dang / don dam bar na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i btang snyoms nyid las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Here, the foundation consciousness itself is the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, and ultimately, equanimity associated with it is the result of both virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: Pleasure and pain are called ‚Äúmaturation‚Äù because they arise from the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de la bde ba myong ba ni @151b gang byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod pa dang / 'gags na slar phrad par 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba myong ba ni @151b gang byung na 'bral bar mi 'dod pa dang / 'gags na slar phrad par 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: Among them, the experience of pleasure is that when it arises, one does not wish to be separated from it, and when it ceases, one wishes to be reunited with it.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa dang / 'gags na slar phrad par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa dang / 'gags na slar phrad par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The experience of pain is that when it arises, one wishes to be separated from it, and when it ceases, one does not wish to be reunited with it.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba myong ba ni gang byung ngam 'gags kyang rung gnyi ga mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin ba myong ba ni gang byung ngam 'gags kyang rung gnyi ga mi skye ba'o //
translated: The experience of neither pleasure nor pain is that when it arises or ceases, neither of these two arises.

original: 'du shes ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of the sign of an object.

original: yul ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object is the objective support.

original: mtshan ma ni de'i bye brag sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni de'i bye brag sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The sign is the cause of the establishment of the object as a particular, such as blue, yellow, etc.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni 'di sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni 'di sngon po nyid yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: Apprehending is the conception that this is blue, not yellow.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid g-yo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid g-yo bar byed pa ste /
translated: Volition is the mental factor that directs the mind.

original: gang yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin du dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is like a magnet that moves iron.

original: tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Feeling is of three types:

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: chos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The mental factors are of four types:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, ethically neutral and obscured, and ethically neutral and unobscured.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshor ba spyir bshad pas tshor ba rnam pa gsum las tshor ba gang yin pa mi shes la ;üîΩde bzhin du de yang ci dge ba'am /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshor ba spyir bshad pas tshor ba rnam pa gsum las tshor ba gang yin pa mi shes la ; de bzhin du de yang ci dge ba'am /
translated: Since the feeling that is explained in the foundation consciousness is a general feeling, it is not known which of the three feelings it is.

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: Similarly, it is not known whether it is virtuous orüîΩnonvirtuous.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: It is indeterminate, either obscured or unobscured.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang yin gtol med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gang yin gtol med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not known which it is, therefore

original: de la tshor ba btang snyoms te /
analyzed: de la tshor ba btang snyoms te /
translated: it is feeling that is equanimity.

original: de ni ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni ma bsgribs lung ma bstan // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is unobscured and indeterminate.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi skabs yin pas der bsnyegs so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid kyi skabs yin pas der bsnyegs so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the foundation consciousness, since the context is the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is feeling that is equanimity in the foundation consciousness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is neither pleasure nor pain,

original: de gnyis kyi dmigs ba dang / rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dmigs ba dang / rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object and aspect of both pleasure and pain.

original: de ni ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de ni ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
translated: It is unobscured and indeterminate.

original: zhes bya ba yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsnyegs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bsnyegs so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the foundation consciousness.

original: de la ma bsgribs pa smos pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ma bsgribs pa smos pa ni bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúunobscured‚Äù is stated to eliminate the obscured indeterminate.

original: lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyid kyis pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo @152a * //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro // yid kyis pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo @152a * //
translated: The statement that it is indeterminate is for the purpose of excluding virtue and nonvirtue.

original: bur ba rnams kyis ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ma bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: bur ba rnams kyis ma bsgribs pa'i phyir ma bsgribs pa'o //
translated: It is unobscured because it is not obscured by the adventitious afflictions of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin par gyur pa ni dge ba dang mi dge bar lung bstan du med pas lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin par gyur pa ni dge ba dang mi dge bar lung bstan du med pas lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is indeterminate because it is not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous, since it is karmic maturation.

original: reg la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: reg la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Contact and so on are also like that.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig tu rnam par smin pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / rtag tu reg pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / de la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid dang /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig tu rnam par smin pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / rtag tu reg pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / de la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid dang /
translated: Just as the one foundation consciousness is karmic maturation, it is not differentiated in terms of object, aspect, or mode of activity, it is always associated with contact and so on, and it is feeling that is equanimity.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yang gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid dang / dmigs ba dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / bdag ma gtogs par gzhan bzhi dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang rtag tu ldan no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yang gcig tu rnam par smin pa nyid dang / dmigs ba dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa dang / bdag ma gtogs par gzhan bzhi dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang rtag tu ldan no //
translated: Contact and so on are also like that, because they are unobscured and undefined, they are solely karmic maturation, they are not differentiated in terms of object and aspect, they are associated with the four mental factors excluding the self, and they are always associated with the storehouse consciousness.

original: de dag las tshor ba btang snyoms nyid dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag las tshor ba btang snyoms nyid dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
translated: Among them, feeling is equanimity, it is unobscured and undefined, and it is like the storehouse consciousness.

original: rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su chad mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su chad mi srid de /
translated: Karmic maturation and its associates are not karmic maturation, and it is impossible for that which is not differentiated in terms of object and aspect to be differentiated in terms of object and aspect.

original: gzhan du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ji srid 'khor gyi nang du tha dad pa med par 'jug pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ji srid 'khor gyi nang du tha dad pa med par 'jug pa zhig gam /
translated: Is the storehouse consciousness always associated with the same contact, etc., or are there different ones?

original: 'on te rgyun gyis 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyun gyis 'jug ce na /
translated: Or, does it operate by means of a continuum?

original: de gcig pu tha dad pa med par 'jug pa ma yin te skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gcig pu tha dad pa med par 'jug pa ma yin te skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not operate as a single, undifferentiated entity, because it is momentary.

original: 'on kyang de ni rgyun 'bab chu bo bzhin //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni rgyun 'bab chu bo bzhin //
translated: However, it is like a river.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù refers to the store consciousness.

original: de la rgyun ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bar chad med par rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la rgyun ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bar chad med par rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: A continuum is an uninterrupted succession of causes and effects.

original: chu'i tshogs kyi snga phyi'i chu rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab ba ni chu bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i tshogs kyi snga phyi'i chu rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab ba ni chu bo zhes bya'o //
translated: A river is a continuous flow of water that occurs without interruption.

original: ji ltar chu bo rtsva dang shing dang lci ba la sogs pa de ded cing 'bab ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi bag chags dang ldan pa yang reg ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa bsdus nas ji srid 'khor gyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo rtsva dang shing dang lci ba la sogs pa de ded cing 'bab ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las kyi bag chags dang ldan pa yang reg ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa bsdus nas ji srid 'khor gyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun du 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as a river carries along grass, sticks, and so on, in the same way the store consciousness, which is endowed with the propensities of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and invariable karma, carries along the appropriating aggregates and so on, and occurs in a continuous stream until the end of samsara.

original: de ltar rgyun du 'byung ba de gang gi tshe na ldog par 'gyur snyam pa la /üîΩdgra bcom nyid na de ldog go //
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du 'byung ba de gang gi tshe na ldog par 'gyur snyam pa la / dgra bcom nyid na de ldog go //
translated: When does this constant occurrence cease?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said: It ceases in the state of an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba ci zhe na gang @152b dang ldan na 'di dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba ci zhe na gang @152b dang ldan na 'di dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the state of an arhat? It is that which is possessed by one called an arhat.

original: ci dang ldan na dgra bcom pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang ldan na dgra bcom pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is possessed by one called an arhat?

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa thob pa'i phyir ro // de'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the attainment of the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the store consciousness ceases because the negative reflex actions in the store consciousness have been completely eliminated.

original: de nyid kyi dus na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dus na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: At that time, one is an arhat.

original: rnam par smin par gyur pa rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam par smin par gyur pa rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the maturation transformation.

original: da ni ngar sems pa zhes bya ba gyur pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ngar sems pa zhes bya ba gyur pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: Now, the second transformation is called the ‚Äúthought of ‚ÄòI.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de la gnas te rab 'byung zhes rgya cher smos pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas te rab 'byung zhes rgya cher smos pa'o //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúDwelling in that, one emerges.‚Äù

original: de la ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs par grags pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas dang dmigs par ma grags te /
