analyzed: de la ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs par grags pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas dang dmigs par ma grags te /
translated: Just as the eyes, etc. are known as the basis of the eye consciousness, etc. and form, etc. are known as the objective domain, the afflicted mind is not known as the basis or objective domain.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas dang dmigs pa la mi ltos pa ni mi rung bas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas dang dmigs pa bstan pa dang / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas dang dmigs pa la mi ltos pa ni mi rung bas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi gnas dang dmigs pa bstan pa dang / nges pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not possible for consciousness to be independent of a basis and objective domain, therefore, in order to teach the basis and objective domain of the afflicted mind and in order to teach its verbal derivation, he says:

original: de la gnas te rab 'byung zhing //
analyzed: de la gnas te rab 'byung zhing //
translated: It arises based on that,

original: de la dmigs pa yid ces bya //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yid ces bya //
translated: and is called mind because it focuses on that.

original: rnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rnam shes ngar sems bdag nyid can //
translated: Consciousness is the nature of self-grasping.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says this.

original: de la gnas te rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnas te rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: Based on that, it arises.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la sbyar ro //
translated: The word that is connected to the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i bag chags kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i bag chags kyi gnas yin te /
translated: The foundation consciousness is the basis of its habitual tendencies.

original: de bas na de la gnas bcas nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na de la gnas bcas nas 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it arises based on that,

original: rgyun gyis skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun gyis skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that it arises through a continuum.

original: yang na khams sems gang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin pa thob par nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de yang khams de dang sa de'i yin te /
analyzed: yang na khams sems gang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam par smin pa thob par nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de yang khams de dang sa de'i yin te /
translated: Or, the afflicted mind that obtains the result of the store consciousness in a certain realm or stage is of that realm and stage,

original: de kun gzhi de la rag lus pas 'jug pa'i phyir de la gnas te 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de kun gzhi de la rag lus pas 'jug pa'i phyir de la gnas te 'byung ba'o //
translated: because it arises based on that, since it engages the store consciousness in dependence on it.

original: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which has it as its object‚Äù means that it has the store consciousness as its object,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lang dang nga yir dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lang dang nga yir dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the afflicted mind is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self, etc., and it takes the store consciousness as ‚Äúme‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na sems gang las byung ba de nyid de'i dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems gang las byung ba de nyid de'i dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the mind that arises from the store consciousness have that store consciousness as its object?

original: ji ltar kha cig de mi 'dod kyang dus la lar sems gang las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de nyid dmigs pa yin zhing de 'byung ba lta bu'o //üîΩyid ces @153a * //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig de mi 'dod kyang dus la lar sems gang las yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de nyid dmigs pa yin zhing de 'byung ba lta bu'o // yid ces @153a * //
translated: Just as, although some do not accept it, at times the mind that is the object of the mental consciousness is the same as that from which the mental consciousness arises.

original: bya ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de la brten te 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam par shes pa ni yid ces bya ba'i rnam par shes pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de la brten te 'byung ba'o //
translated: The consciousness called manas is the consciousness called manas that is the store consciousness.

original: de la dmigs pa yid ces bya //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yid ces bya //
translated: It is called manas because it has that as its object.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: This shows that it is distinguished from the store consciousness and the active consciousnesses.

original: yang de'i rang bzhin gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: yang de'i rang bzhin gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is its nature?

original: ngar sems bdag nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ngar sems bdag nyid can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be the nature of self-notion.

original: de ltar ngar sems pa'i bdag nyid yin pas nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngar sems pa'i bdag nyid yin pas nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called manas in the sense of the Sanskrit verbal root man, to think, because it is the nature of the notion of an ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas de nges par sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur na sems las byung ba ni gang dag dang ji snyed dus ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas de nges par sems las byung ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur na sems las byung ba ni gang dag dang ji snyed dus ni /
translated: Since it is the nature of consciousness, it definitely is concomitant with mental factors. What are the mental factors and how many are there?

original: ji srid du mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba de mi shes te /
analyzed: ji srid du mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba de mi shes te /
translated: Since it is the intrinsic nature of consciousness, it is definitely concomitant with mental factors. But it is not known which mental factors and for how long they are concomitant.

original: de'i phyir / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i //
translated: Therefore he says:

original: nyon mongs bzhi dang rtag tu 'grogs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs bzhi dang rtag tu 'grogs // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is always accompanied by four afflictionsüîΩthat are obscured and ethically neutral.

original: sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Mental factors are of two types:

original: nyon mongs pa dang de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang de las gzhan pa'o //

original: de las gzhan pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to distinguish it from those other than afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'ang drug ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'ang drug ste /
translated: There are six afflictions,

analyzed: de dag thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pas de'i phyir bzhi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: but since it is not concomitant with all of them, he says four.

original: 'grogs zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'grogs zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'o //

original: nyon mongs ba yang rnam pa gnyis te mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba yang rnam pa gnyis te mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Afflictions are also of two kinds: unwholesome and obscured neutral.

original: mi dge ba dag las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi dge ba dag las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to distinguish them from the unwholesome, the text says ‚Äúobscured neutral.‚Äù

original: bsgribs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi dge ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi srid de /
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mi dge ba rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for the obscured consciousness to be associated with the unwholesome afflictions.

original: bsgribs ba ni nyon mongs ba can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs ba ni nyon mongs ba can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the obscured is afflicted,

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du lung bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the neutral is not declared to be wholesome or unwholesome.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means at all times.

original: ji srid du de yod pa de srid du de dag dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: ji srid du de yod pa de srid du de dag dang mtshungs par ldan no //

analyzed: spyir bstan pas khyad par mi shes nas khyad par ston to // bdag tu lta dang bdag tu rmongs //
translated: Since it is a general statement, it does not specify.üîΩThe view of self, self-delusion,

original: bdag rgyal bdag chags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag rgyal bdag chags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: self-pride, and self-love.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag tu mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag tu mthong ba ni bdag tu lta ba ste /

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with the view of the perishable as a self.

original: rmongs pa ni mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni mi shes pa ste /

analyzed: bdag @153b mi shes pa ni bdag tu rmongs pa'o //

analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal ni bdag gi yul la ngar sems pa ste /

analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: bdag chags ni bdag la chags pa ste /

analyzed: de gsum yod na bdag tu bsams pa'i dngos bo la mngon bar chags pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la chags pa'o //

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:üîΩThrough these four‚Äîignorance, the view of the transitory aggregates,

original: ma rig pa dang bdag lta dang // nga'o nga rgyal srid 'di bzhis //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bdag lta dang // nga'o nga rgyal srid 'di bzhis //
translated: pride in the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and desire for the self‚Äî

analyzed: kun gzhi nyon mongs can 'gyur yid //

original: ngar sems pa yi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: ngar sems pa yi mtshan nyid de //

original: phyin ci log gi rgyu byed pa'ang //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rgyu byed pa'ang //
translated: is the cause of error.üîΩThe store consciousness is afflicted

original: yid de de dag nyon mongs can //
analyzed: yid de de dag nyon mongs can //
translated: when it is associated with these four afflictions.

original: sems dge lung du ma bstan tshe //
analyzed: sems dge lung du ma bstan tshe //
translated: When the mind is virtuous or indeterminate,

original: rtag tu ngar 'dzin rgyu yin no ;
analyzed: rtag tu ngar 'dzin rgyu yin no ;
translated: the cause of the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is always present.

original: / bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yid bzhin dus dgu pa ste /üîΩ'dir spyir brjod pa ci rang gis pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan nam /
analyzed: / bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yid bzhin dus dgu pa ste / 'dir spyir brjod pa ci rang gis pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan nam /
translated: These afflictions, such as the confusion of self, are like the mind in the nine stages.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi shes nas /
translated: Here, it is not known whether they are in general associated with the same stage or with other stages.

original: de'i phyir gang du skyes pa de'i'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du skyes pa de'i'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThey are of the stage in which they occur.‚Äù

original: gang du skyes pa ni gang du byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa ni gang du byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe stage in which they occur‚Äù means the stage in which they arise.

original: de'i'o zhes bya ba ni khams dang sa gang du skyes pa khams de dang sa de nyid kyi dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: de'i'o zhes bya ba ni khams dang sa gang du skyes pa khams de dang sa de nyid kyi dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: That is, it is concomitant with that realm and level in whatever realm and level it arises.

original: khams gzhan dag kyang sa gzhan dag gi dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gzhan dag kyang sa gzhan dag gi dang ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not concomitant with other realms and other levels.

original: ci de nyon mongs pa bzhi nyid dang mtshungs par ldan nam /
analyzed: ci de nyon mongs pa bzhi nyid dang mtshungs par ldan nam /
translated: Are these four afflictions alone concomitant?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'on kyang gzhan reg sogs kyang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan reg sogs kyang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: However, contact and so on are also concomitant.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word also indicates that they are included.

original: reg sogs zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems ba ste /
analyzed: reg sogs zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems ba ste /
translated: Contact and so on refers to contact, mental attention, feeling, discrimination, and intention.

original: chos lnga po de dag ni kun du 'gro bas rnam par shes pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: chos lnga po de dag ni kun du 'gro bas rnam par shes pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: These five phenomena are omnipresent and concomitant with all consciousness.

original: de dag kyang gang du skyes pa de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang du skyes pa de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan gyi /
translated: They are concomitant with that very realm and level in which they arise.

original: khams dang sa gzhan gyi dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khams dang sa gzhan gyi dang ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant with other realms and other levels.

original: yang na gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir te /üîΩrtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ni ma @154a * //
analyzed: yang na gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir te / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ni ma @154a * //
translated: Or else, the other is the root consciousness, because they are distinguished from those associated with it.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The contact, etc. of the root consciousness are unobscured-indeterminate.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid bzhin du bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid bzhin du bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The afflicted mind is obscured-indeterminate like the mind.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dus na yang bye brag med par 'byung na ni de'i ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dus na yang bye brag med par 'byung na ni de'i ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the afflicted mind were to occur without distinction in the times of virtue, affliction, and indeterminacy, then it would not cease.

original: mi ldog na ni de la thar pa ga la yod de thar pa med par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi ldog na ni de la thar pa ga la yod de thar pa med par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it did not cease, how could there be liberation from it?

original: mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te //
translated: It would not be liberation.

original: 'di ltar de la dgra bcom med //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la dgra bcom med //
translated: In this way, there is no arhat

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug la med //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug la med //
translated: in the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam na'ang med //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam na'ang med //
translated: nor in the transcendent path.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med de /
translated: Arhats do not have afflicted intellect because they have abandoned all afflictions.

original: de ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa na bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis spongs te /
analyzed: de ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa na bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis spongs te /
translated: When they obtain the state of an arhat, they abandon the afflicted intellect, like the afflictions of the summit of existence that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, through the uninterrupted path alone.

original: de na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi tshe na nyon mongs pa gzhan bzhin du med do //
analyzed: de na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi tshe na nyon mongs pa gzhan bzhin du med do //
translated: At the time of obtaining the state of an arhat, it is like other afflictions.

original: phyir mi 'ang ba ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa yang lam gyi stobs kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na yang lam bzhin du 'gag par
analyzed: phyir mi 'ang ba ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa yang lam gyi stobs kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na yang lam bzhin du 'gag par
translated: Nonreturners who are free of attachment to the base of nothingness and who obtain the meditative attainment of cessation also obtain the meditative attainment of cessation through the power of the path. Therefore, when they enter the meditative attainment of cessation, like the path, it ceases.

original: 'gyur ro // 'gog pa las langs nas yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'gog pa las langs nas yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: When they arise from cessation, they arise from the foundation consciousness alone.

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam na'ang med //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i lam na'ang med //
translated: Nor does it exist on the transcendent path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútranscendent‚Äù is used to exclude the mundane.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam na ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: In the mundane path, the afflicted mind does not cease.

original: bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag la sogs par lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam na de 'byung bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba ni bdag la sogs par lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam na de 'byung bar mi nus te /
translated: Since the view of self and so on is the antidote to the view of selflessness, it is impossible for that to occur in the transcendent path.

original: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis cig car du med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam na de 'gag go //
analyzed: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis cig car du med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam na de 'gag go //
translated: Since the antidote and its counteragent do not occur simultaneously, it ceases in the transcendent path.

original: de las langs nas yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las langs nas yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: Arising from that, it again arises from the store consciousness.

original: 'di ni gyur ba nyid pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gyur ba nyid pa'o //
translated: This is the transformation itself.

original: zhes bstan pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa bshad zin to //
translated: This concludes the explanation.

original: zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: gyur pa gnyis pa'i 'og tu gyur ba gsum pa brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: gyur pa gnyis pa'i 'og tu gyur ba gsum pa brjod dgos pas /
translated: After the second transformation, the third transformation must be mentioned.

original: gsum pa yul rnam drug po la //
analyzed: gsum pa yul rnam drug po la //
translated: The third is the object of the six kinds of consciousness.

original: dmigs pa gang yin de dag ste //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin de dag ste //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Whatever is the object of those, that is the third transformation.

original: gsum @154b pa ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //üîΩrnam drug ces bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gsum @154b pa ni rnam par shes pa gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o // rnam drug ces bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The third line is the remainder of the sentence, ‚Äúthe transformation of consciousness.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi bdag nyid kyi yul lo //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi bdag nyid kyi yul lo //
translated: The six kinds means the six kinds of objects: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: yul la dmigs pa gang yin pa ni 'dzin pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa gang yin pa ni 'dzin pa dang rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the objects as its domain‚Äù means that it is the apprehender and the conceiver.

original: de yang ci dge ba'am mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa zhig ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / dge dang mi dge gnyi ga min //
analyzed: de yang ci dge ba'am mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa zhig ce na / de'i phyir / dge dang mi dge gnyi ga min //
translated: Is it virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩIt is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neither.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / gnyi ga min zhes bya ba lung du ma bstan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / gnyi ga min zhes bya ba lung du ma bstan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not indeterminate, which is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: That which is concomitant with nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion is virtuous.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: That which is concomitant with attachment, hatred, and delusion is nonvirtuous.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: Neither virtue nor nonvirtue is that which is concomitant with neither virtue nor nonvirtue.

original: dge ba'ang ma yin mi dge ba'ang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'ang ma yin mi dge ba'ang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: de yang sems las byung ba ci 'dra ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni ci snyed cig yod ce na /
analyzed: de yang sems las byung ba ci 'dra ba dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba ni ci snyed cig yod ce na /
translated: How many mental factors are concomitant with that which is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous?üîΩThus he says,

original: de'i phyir / kun du 'gro ba bye brag nges //
analyzed: de'i phyir / kun du 'gro ba bye brag nges //
translated: The universal mental factors are determined.üîΩThe virtuous mental factors,

original: sems las byung ba dge ba dang // de bzhin nyon mongs nye nyon mongs //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dge ba dang // de bzhin nyon mongs nye nyon mongs //
translated: and likewise the afflictions and branch afflictions,

original: tshor ba gsum dang de mtshungs ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum dang de mtshungs ldan // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: are concomitant with the three feelings.

original: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa de dag mi shes te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa de dag mi shes te /
translated: The universal mental factors and so on that are taught are not understood.

original: de bas na de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to clearly teach them,

original: dang bo'i reg la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dang bo'i reg la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe first is contact and so on.‚Äù

original: thog mar bshad pas dang po ste //
analyzed: thog mar bshad pas dang po ste //
translated: The first is explained first.

original: 'di ltar kun du 'gro ba dang // rtag tu reg dang yid byed dang // reg dang 'du shes sems par ldan //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun du 'gro ba dang // rtag tu reg dang yid byed dang // reg dang 'du shes sems par ldan //
translated: Contact, attention, feeling, perception, and volition.

original: zhes bya ba thog ma nyid du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba thog ma nyid du bshad pa'o //
translated: These are explained first.

original: de dag gi dang po ni reg pa yin pas reg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dang po ni reg pa yin pas reg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since contact is the first of these, they are called contact and so on.

original: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa chos lnga po de dag ni sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba dag go //
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa chos lnga po de dag ni sems thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba dag go //
translated: These five phenomena, contact, attention, and so on, are called universal because they are associated with all minds.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la bye brag med par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la bye brag med par 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, they occur without distinction in the store consciousness, the afflicted mind, and the active forms of consciousness.

original: bye brag tu nges pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩ'dun mos dran dang bcas pa dang // ting nge 'dzin blo bye brag nges //
analyzed: bye brag tu nges pa'i dbang du byas nas / 'dun mos dran dang bcas pa dang // ting nge 'dzin blo bye brag nges //
translated: In terms of their specific determinations,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the root text states, ‚Äúwill, desire, recollection, samƒÅdhi, and discernment are determined in specific ways.‚Äù

original: bye brag can la nges pas bye brag tu nges pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag can la nges pas bye brag tu nges pa ste /
translated: Discernment is determined in specific ways because it is determined in specific ways.

original: @155a * // de dag gi yul ni bye brag can nyid yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @155a * // de dag gi yul ni bye brag can nyid yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Their objects are specific, not all.

original: de la 'dun pa ni bsams pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni bsams pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ste /
translated: Aspiration is the desire for a considered object.

original: ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //üîΩblta ba dang mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa'i yul bsams pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsams pa la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir yul so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yin no // blta ba dang mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa'i yul bsams pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni bsams pa'o //
translated: Since there is no aspiration for an unconsidered object, it is taught to have a specific object.üîΩA considered object is one that is thought about, such as something to be seen, heard, etc.

original: de la mthong ba dang thos ba la sogs par smon pa ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba dang thos ba la sogs par smon pa ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Aspiration is the desire to see, hear, etc., that considered object.

original: da ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: da ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the undertaking of striving.

original: mos pa ni nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni nges pa'i dngos po la de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Interest is the holding of a determined object as being just as it is determined.

original: nges par smos pa ni nges pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges par smos pa ni nges pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúdetermined‚Äù is used to exclude the undetermined.

original: rigs pa'am yid ches pa'i lung gi dngos po la the tshom med pa gang yin pa de nges pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'am yid ches pa'i lung gi dngos po la the tshom med pa gang yin pa de nges pa ste /
translated: Interest is the absence of doubt with regard to an object that is reasonable or known by trustworthy statements.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis dngos po de la sems 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis rnam par nges pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis dngos po de la sems 'jog pa ste /
translated: The mind is fixed on that entity by the same aspect by which it is ascertained, impermanent, painful, etc.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: Faith is the conviction that it is just so, not otherwise.

original: de ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'phrogs pa nyid kyi las can te /
translated: Its function is to make one unassailable.

original: mos pa gces su byed pa ni phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las 'phrog par mi nus so //
analyzed: mos pa gces su byed pa ni phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las 'phrog par mi nus so //
translated: One who values faith cannot be led away from his own doctrine by adversaries.

original: dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
translated: Recollection is the non-loss of a familiar entity.

original: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the mental expression.

original: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon gyi myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i dngos po ni sngon gyi myong ba'o //
translated: A familiar entity is one that has been previously experienced.

original: ma brjed pa ni dmigs pa la 'dzin pa chud mi za bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma brjed pa ni dmigs pa la 'dzin pa chud mi za bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Non-loss is the cause of the nondisappearance of the apprehension of the object.

original: sngon bzung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang dang yang dran ba ni mngon par brjod pa ste mngon par brjod pa kho na mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon bzung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang dang yang dran ba ni mngon par brjod pa ste mngon par brjod pa kho na mngon par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Recollection is the repeated bringing to mind of the object that has been grasped.

original: de ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can te /üîΩdmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yod na dmigs pa gzhan nam /
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i las can te / dmigs pa mngon par brjod pa yod na dmigs pa gzhan nam /
translated: It has the function of preventing distraction,

original: rnam pa gzhan la sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan la sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pas rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i las can no //
translated: because when there is recollection of the object, the mind is not distracted to other objects or other aspects.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //üîΩbrtag pa'i dngos po ni yon tan du'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do // brtag pa'i dngos po ni yon tan du'am /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on an examined object.

original: nges par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par brtag par bya'o //
translated: An examined object is either a virtuous or a nonvirtuous object that has been investigated and determined.

original: rtse gcig pa nyid ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa nyid ni dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: One-pointedness is the single object of the mind.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting knowledge, because when the mind is concentrated, one knows things as they are.

original: blo ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: blo ni shes rab bo //
translated: Discrimination is wisdom.

original: de yang brtag pa'i @155b dngos po nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang brtag pa'i @155b dngos po nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the thorough differentiation of the very things to be examined.

original: rigs pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / gzhan pa'o //
translated: It is that which is produced by reason, by what is unreasonable, and by other things.

original: rnam par 'byed par byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is thorough differentiation because it differentiates.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag pa'am log par so sor rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dres pa lta bu'i chos rnams la yang dag pa'am log par so sor rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the correct or incorrect discrimination of things that are mixed, such as the general and particular characteristics.

original: rigs pa ni gsha' ba ste /
analyzed: rigs pa ni gsha' ba ste /
translated: Reason is the cause.

original: de yang yid ches pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de yang yid ches pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum mo //
translated: It is the three: trustworthy scripture, inference, and direct perception.

original: rigs pa rnam pa de gsum gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa de gsum gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: That which is produced by these three reasons is produced by reason.

original: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
translated: It is that which arises from hearing, reflection, and meditative cultivation.

original: de la yid ches pa'i gsung rab tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la yid ches pa'i gsung rab tshad ma nyid kyis rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which is understood by means of the authority of trustworthy scripture is that which arises from hearing.

original: rigs pa nges par sems pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa nges par sems pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the reflection on reason is derived from the heard and the considered.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from concentration is derived from cultivation.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag par snang ba dang / log par bsams pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa ni yid ches pa ma yin pa'i lung dang / rjes su dpag par snang ba dang / log par bsams pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The unreasonable is the nonauthoritative scripture, the semblance of inference, and the concentration of wrong reflection.

original: rigs ba ma yin pa des bskyed pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o //üîΩskye ba thob pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad shes pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rigs ba ma yin pa des bskyed pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'o // skye ba thob pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad shes pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa'ang ma yin /
translated: That which is generated by that unreasonable is generated by the unreasonable.

original: mi rigs pas bskyed pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rigs pas bskyed pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of birth and worldly convention is neither generated by reason nor generated by the unreasonable.

original: 'di ni som nyi zlog pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni som nyi zlog pa'i las can te /
translated: This has the function of eliminating doubt.

original: som nyi zlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rnams rab tu rnam par phye nas nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: som nyi zlog pa ni shes rab kyis chos rnams rab tu rnam par phye nas nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elimination of doubt is because one obtains certainty by means of wisdom after having distinguished the dharmas.

original: chos lnga po de dag ni phan tshun tha dad du gyur nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos lnga po de dag ni phan tshun tha dad du gyur nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: These five dharmas occur as mutually distinct.

original: de ltar na gang du mos pa der gzhan dag gdon mi za bar mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gang du mos pa der gzhan dag gdon mi za bar mi 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, in whatever way one is inclined, one should not doubt that others will not be inclined in the same way.

original: thams cad la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for all the other virtues.

original: bye brag tu nges pa rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: bye brag tu nges pa rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The specific determinations have been explained.

original: // / da ni de'i 'og tu bstan pa dge ba dag brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni de'i 'og tu bstan pa dge ba dag brjod dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Now, after that, the virtues should be mentioned, so it is said:üîΩFaith, conscience, shame, non-greed, etc.,

original: dad dang ngo tsha khrel yod dang // ma chags la sogs gsum brtson 'grus //
analyzed: dad dang ngo tsha khrel yod dang // ma chags la sogs gsum brtson 'grus //
translated: effort,

original: shin tu sbyangs dang bag yod bcas //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs dang bag yod bcas //
translated: pliancy, heedfulness,

original: rnam mi 'tshe dge zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam mi 'tshe dge zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: non-violence, and virtue.

original: de dag ni chos bcu gcig go zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de dag ni chos bcu gcig go zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: These are the eleven dharmas.

original: de la dad pa ni las dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa dang / dkon mchog yod pa dang / yon tan can dang nus pa dag la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang @156a * //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni las dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa dang / dkon mchog yod pa dang / yon tan can dang nus pa dag la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang @156a * //
translated: Here, faith is clear, pure, and confident cognition with regard to karma, its results, the Three Jewels, and their qualities and abilities.

original: ba dang / 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the inclination of mind and the desire for virtue.

original: dad pa ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Faith is threefold:

original: dngos po yod pa yon tan can nam /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa yon tan can nam /
translated: with regard to existent things that have qualities,

original: yon tan can ma yin pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / yod pa yon tan can la dang ba'i rnam pa dang / yod pa yon tan thob bar byed dam skyes pa nus pa la 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan can ma yin pa la yid ches pa'i rnam pa dang / yod pa yon tan can la dang ba'i rnam pa dang / yod pa yon tan thob bar byed dam skyes pa nus pa la 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form of faith that is confidence in those who are not virtuous, the form of faith that is clarity toward those who are virtuous, and the form of faith that is desire for the attainment or production of virtue.

original: sems dang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Faith is clarity of mind.üîΩFaith is clarity of mind because it is the opposite of mental turbidity. Therefore, it is associated with the absence of the turbidity of the stains of the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions. It is called clarity because it is based on clarity of mind.üîΩIts action is to support aspiration.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of or as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.

original: dad pa ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa med pas sems dang ba la brten te dang bar 'gyur bas ngang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni sems kyi rnyog pa dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma'i rnyog pa med pas sems dang ba la brten te dang bar 'gyur bas ngang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of or as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩSpiritual superiors are those who are virtuous.

original: de ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //üîΩngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no // ngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Temporal superiors are those who are powerful.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩIt is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of or as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩSpiritual superiors are those who are virtuous.üîΩTemporal superiors are those who are powerful.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of spiritual or temporal superiors.

original: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //üîΩdam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o // dam pa rnams kyis smad pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: It is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of or as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩSpiritual superiors are those who are virtuous.üîΩTemporal superiors are those who are powerful.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩIt is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.

original: sdig pa nyid kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: sdig pa nyid kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: Spiritual superiors are those who are virtuous.üîΩTemporal superiors are those who are powerful.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩIt is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩSpiritual superiors are those who are virtuous.

original: byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
analyzed: byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
translated: Temporal superiors are those who are powerful.üîΩShame is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as being in the presence of spiritual or temporal superiors.üîΩIt is the avoidance of what is objectionable because of considering oneself as having an obligation to spiritual or temporal superiors.

original: kha na ma tho ba des /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba des /
translated: By that sin,üîΩ

original: sems bag 'khums pa'i 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems bag 'khums pa'i 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni ngo tsha shes pa'o //
translated: Shame is the avoidance of evil due to that very sense of shame.

original: 'di ni nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the avoidance of misdeeds.

original: khrel yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o //
translated: Embarrassment is the avoidance of evil due to consideration of the world.

original: 'jig rten na 'di ni smad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'di ni smad pa ste /
translated: In the world, this is despised.

original: bdag la las 'di lta bu rig na smod par 'gyur ro zhes tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa la sogs ba'i 'jigs pas kha na ma tho ba la 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la las 'di lta bu rig na smod par 'gyur ro zhes tshigs su bcad pa ma yin pa la sogs ba'i 'jigs pas kha na ma tho ba la 'dzem pa ste /
translated: One avoids evil due to the fear of being called a non-poet, etc.

original: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa legs par sdom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the avoidance of misdeeds.

original: ma chags pa ni chags pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa ni chags pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Non-greed is the antidote to greed.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa dang smon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la kun tu chags pa dang smon pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Greed is the desire and aspiration for existence and the instruments of existence.

original: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni ma chags pa ste /
translated: Its antidote is non-greed.üîΩNon-hatred is the antidote to hatred.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la ma chags pa dang mi phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad rnams la ma chags pa dang mi phyogs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-attachment and non-aversion to existence and the necessities of existence.

original: 'di ni nyes bar spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes bar spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the non-engagement in misdeeds.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Non-hatred is the antidote to hatred.

original: zhe sdang ni sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: Hatred is the malevolence toward sentient beings, suffering, and the things that cause suffering.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal @156b ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems med pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po yin pas sems can rnams dang / sdug bsngal @156b ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la kun nas mnar sems med pa'o //
translated: Non-hatred is the antidote to hatred. It is the absence of malevolence toward sentient beings, suffering, and the things that cause suffering.

original: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the non-engagement in misdeeds.

original: gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Non-delusion is the antidote to delusion.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the correct understanding of things as they are.

original: gti mug ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa'o //
translated: Delusion is the non-understanding of action and result, the truths, and the Jewels.

original: gti mug gi gnyen po yin pas gti mug med pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog de dag yang dag par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi gnyen po yin pas gti mug med pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog de dag yang dag par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Non-delusion is the antidote to delusion. It is the correct understanding of action and result, the truths, and the Jewels.

original: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di yang nyes par spyod pa la mi 'jug pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of providing a basis for not engaging in misdeeds.

original: brtson 'grus ni le lo'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni le lo'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Diligence is the antidote to laziness.

original: dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba yin gyi /
translated: It is the mental factor that is the enthusiasm for virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa can la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the enthusiasm for that which is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni le lo yin pas le lo nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la spro ba ni le lo yin pas le lo nyid do //
translated: The enthusiasm for that which is afflicted is laziness.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed ba dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs yongs su rdzogs par byed ba dang / yongs su sgrub pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of completing and accomplishing the virtuous side.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: Lightness is the antidote to indisposition.

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: It is the serviceability of body and mind.

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon rnams te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon rnams te /
translated: The body and mind are unfit for action due to the indisposition of the body and mind.

original: de med na shin tu sbyangs pa yod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na shin tu sbyangs pa yod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When that is absent, there is fitness.

original: de la lus las su rung ba ni lus rang gi dgos pa rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus las su rung ba ni lus rang gi dgos pa rnams la ldang ba yang ba gang las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Fitness of the body is the lightness of the body that arises from its ability to perform its own functions.

original: sems las su rung ba ni yang dag pa yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyi sim pa dang / yang ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba ni yang dag pa yid la byed pa la zhugs pa'i sems kyi sim pa dang / yang ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Fitness of the mind is a mental factor that is a cause of the satisfaction and lightness of mind that occurs when one engages in proper attention.

original: de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir sems las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan na dmigs pa la sems thogs pa med par 'jug pas de'i phyir sems las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one possesses that, the mind enters its object without obstruction. Therefore, it is called fitness of the mind.

original: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par dga' bas zin pa la lus shin tu sbyangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi reg bya'i khyad par dga' bas zin pa la lus shin tu sbyangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that physical fitness is the special tactile object of pleasure that is experienced by the body.

original: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a sutra declares, ‚ÄúWhen the mind is pleased, the body becomes fit. ‚Äù

original: 'di ni de'i dbang gis gnas gyur pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par sel ba'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i dbang gis gnas gyur pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par sel ba'i las can no //
translated: Since it is the basis of that, it has the function of eliminating all the afflictive obstructions.

original: bag yod bcas ni bag yod pa dang bcas pas bag yod bcas pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod bcas ni bag yod pa dang bcas pas bag yod bcas pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúwith heedfulness‚Äù means with heedfulness.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: btang snyoms so //
analyzed: btang snyoms so //
translated: It is equanimity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig tu dge ba dang 'dir dge ba thams cad bshad pa'i @157a * //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba dang 'dir dge ba thams cad bshad pa'i @157a * //
translated: Because it is virtuous in one way, because this is the context for explaining all virtues,

original: skabs yin pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du mngon du ma smos pa dang / dge ba lhag pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs yin pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du mngon du ma smos pa dang / dge ba lhag pa gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not mentioned explicitly like faith and so on, and because there is no other virtue that is superior to it.

original: btang snyoms nyid la bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: btang snyoms nyid la bya bar mngon no //
translated: It is clear that equanimity is the meaning of ‚Äúwith heedfulness.‚Äù

original: de la bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Heedfulness is the antidote to heedlessness.

original: ma chags ba nas brtson 'grus kyi bar ni bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: ma chags ba nas brtson 'grus kyi bar ni bag yod pa ste /
translated: Nonattachment and so on up to effort are heedfulness.

original: gang ma chags pa la sogs pa la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spod zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang sgom pa ma chags pa la sogs pa de dag ni bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma chags pa la sogs pa la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams spod zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang sgom pa ma chags pa la sogs pa de dag ni bag yod pa'o //
translated: Those nonattachments and so on that abide in nonattachment and so on, that abandon nonvirtuous dharmas and cultivate the virtuous dharmas that are their antidotes, are heedfulness.

original: de bas na bag med pa'i gnyen po nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na bag med pa'i gnyen po nyid de /
translated: Therefore, it is the antidote to heedlessness.

original: bag med pa ni 'di las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag med pa ni 'di las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the opposite of heedlessness.

original: de ni 'jig rten ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of perfecting all mundane and supramundane excellences.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'jug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'jug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid de /
translated: Equanimity is the sameness of mind, the natural state of mind, and the spontaneity of mind.

original: tshig 'di gsum gyis btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i dus bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'di gsum gyis btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma'i dus bstan to //
translated: These three terms indicate the beginning, middle, and end of equanimity.

original: 'di la bying ba dang / rgod pa ni sems mi mnyam ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bying ba dang / rgod pa ni sems mi mnyam ba ste /
translated: Here, sinking and excitedness are the unevenness of mind.

original: de med pas thog mar sems mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas thog mar sems mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are absent, there is the sameness of mind at the beginning.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du bya ba med cing bsgrim mi dgos par mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ci rigs par mnyam ba nyid du 'jug ba ni rnal du 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'du bya ba med cing bsgrim mi dgos par mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ci rigs par mnyam ba nyid du 'jug ba ni rnal du 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: After that, the natural state of mind is the appropriate sameness of mind in equipoise, without the need for application and effort.

original: de'i dus na bsgoms nas ring por ma lon pa'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung bar dogs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de'i dus na bsgoms nas ring por ma lon pa'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung bar dogs pa dang ldan no //
translated: At that time, because it has not been long since one began to cultivate it, one is concerned that sinking and excitedness will occur.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom ba khyad zhugs par gyur pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du gyur ba'i phyir dgos pa med de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom ba khyad zhugs par gyur pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thag ring du gyur ba'i phyir dgos pa med de /
translated: After that, because the cultivation becomes distinctive, its resistance is far away, and so there is no need for it.

original: byid ba dang rgod pa ni gnyen po'i rgyu rnams la rtsol ba mi byed par lhun gyis grub pa'i dus na sems lhun gyis grub ba nyid de /
analyzed: byid ba dang rgod pa ni gnyen po'i rgyu rnams la rtsol ba mi byed par lhun gyis grub pa'i dus na sems lhun gyis grub ba nyid de /
translated: Sinking and excitedness are absent when the mind is spontaneous, without effort in the causes of the antidote.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi skabs mi 'byed pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to provide a basis for not allowing any opportunity to all the root and secondary mental afflictions.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Nonviolence is the antidote to violence.

original: gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho mi 'tshams bas mi 'tshe ba ste /
analyzed: gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho mi 'tshams bas mi 'tshe ba ste /
translated: Nonviolence is the non-injury of sentient beings through killing, binding, and so on.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje ba //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje ba //
translated: It is compassion for sentient beings.

original: bsod nyams sel bas snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nyams sel bas snying rje ba'o //
translated: It is compassion because it removes suffering.

original: bsod nyams zhes bya ba ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nyams zhes bya ba ni bde ba ste /
translated: The term enjoyment means happiness.

original: bde ba sel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba sel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is happiness that is removed.

original: snying rje can ni pha rol sdug @157b bsngal na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje can ni pha rol sdug @157b bsngal na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The compassionate one is one who suffers when others suffer.

original: 'di ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i las can no //
translated: This is the action of non-violence.

original: dge ba bcu gcig bshad zin to /
analyzed: dge ba bcu gcig bshad zin to /
translated: The eleven virtues have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa rnams bstan pas de'i phyir de dag gi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa rnams bstan pas de'i phyir de dag gi dbang du byas te /
translated: After that, the afflictions are taught. Therefore, in terms of them,

original: nyon mongs ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs ni /
translated: the afflictions are:üîΩattachment, anger, delusion,

original: 'dod chags khong khro gti mug dang // nga rgyal lta ba the tshom mo //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags khong khro gti mug dang // nga rgyal lta ba the tshom mo // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: pride, false views, and doubt.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang gti mug ni 'dod chags khong khro gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang gti mug ni 'dod chags khong khro gti mug go //
translated: Attachment, anger, and delusion are attachment, anger, and delusion.

original: de la 'dod chags ni srid pa dang longs spyod la lhag par chags pa dang smon pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni srid pa dang longs spyod la lhag par chags pa dang smon pa ste /
translated: Among them, attachment is the excessive attachment to and aspiration for existence and enjoyments.

original: de ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal kun bskyed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the action of generating all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni 'dir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'dir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /
translated: Suffering here is the appropriated aggregates.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i dbang gis mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi las ni sdug bsngal kun skyed par bshad do //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i dbang gis mngon par 'grub pas de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi las ni sdug bsngal kun skyed par bshad do //
translated: They are actualized by the power of existence in the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm. Therefore, it is said that the action of attachment generates all suffering.

original: khong khro ba ni sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba ni sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: Hatred is the state of mind that torments sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sems rtsub pa'o //
translated: It is a harsh state of mind toward sentient beings.

original: des non na sems can rnams la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems so //
analyzed: des non na sems can rnams la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa bya bar sems so //
translated: When one is overcome by it, one thinks of harming sentient beings by killing them, binding them, and so on.

original: de ni reg par mi gnas pa dang nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni reg par mi gnas pa dang nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting the lack of contact and misconduct.

original: reg pa ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni bde ba ste /
translated: Contact is pleasure.

original: de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni reg par gnas pa'o //
translated: To dwell together with it is to dwell in contact.

original: reg pa dang gnas ma yin pa ni reg par mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa dang gnas ma yin pa ni reg par mi gnas pa ste /
translated: To not dwell in contact is to not dwell in contact.

original: sdug bsngal lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal lhan cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means to dwell with suffering.

original: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems yod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir sems la gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems yod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir sems la gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a hostile mind, there is certainly mental distress, and the mind is tormented.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus la yang gdung bar yang 'gyur ba nyid de'i spyod lam thams cad du sdug bsngal dang bcas shing phongs ba dang bcas par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'gyur bas lus la yang gdung bar yang 'gyur ba nyid de'i spyod lam thams cad du sdug bsngal dang bcas shing phongs ba dang bcas par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is associated with the mind, the body is also tormented. In all his postures, he lives with suffering and distress.

original: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni nyes bar spyod pa gang dang yang rigs pa ma yin pas khong khro ba ni reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can du bshad do //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni nyes bar spyod pa gang dang yang rigs pa ma yin pas khong khro ba ni reg par mi gnas pa dang / nyes par spyod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can du bshad do //
translated: Since it is not proper for one who has a hostile mind to do anything good, hostility is explained as having the function of supporting evil conduct.

original: gti mug ni ngan song rnams dang bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang de thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa phyin ci ma log pa la gang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni ngan song rnams dang bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang de thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa phyin ci ma log pa la gang mi shes pa'o //
translated: Delusion is the lack of knowledge about the miserable realms, good rebirths, nirvana, the causes that bring them about, and the correct connection between their causes and effects.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung @158a * //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung @158a * //
translated: This is the origin of the afflictions.üîΩ

original: ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting the arising of the defilements.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ste las dang / skye ba'i bdag nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ste las dang / skye ba'i bdag nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The defilements, actions, and births are the three kinds of defilements.

original: de 'byung ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i snga ma snga ma rgyur gyur pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i bdag nyid rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i snga ma snga ma rgyur gyur pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa phyi ma phyi ma'i bdag nyid rnyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of the defilements is the acquisition of the nature of the subsequent defilements from the prior defilements which are the cause.

original: 'byung ba'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par gyur la log par shes pa dang the tshom dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa las yang srid pa'i las dang skye ba rnams 'byung gi rmongs par ma gyur na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rten byed pa ni rmongs par gyur la log par shes pa dang the tshom dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa las yang srid pa'i las dang skye ba rnams 'byung gi rmongs par ma gyur na ni ma yin no //
translated: The function of supporting the arising is that from the defilements of delusion, false knowledge, doubt, craving, etc., there arises again the karma and birth which are the cause of existence. But if there is no delusion, they do not arise.üîΩPride is the inflation of the mind.

original: nga rgyal ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: All the various kinds of pride arise in dependence on the false view of individuality.

original: de ni sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It has the characteristic of an inflated mind.

original: 'di ltar phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dngos por sgro btags nas /üîΩ'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po rnams la bdag gam bdag gi dngos por sgro btags nas / 'di ni bdag go //
translated: Thus, having exaggerated the self or what belongs to the self in the aggregates,üîΩone becomes proud, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is my self,‚Äù

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes de dang de'i khyad par gyis bdag khengs shing gzhan dag las lhag par rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes de dang de'i khyad par gyis bdag khengs shing gzhan dag las lhag par rlom sems pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is what belongs to my self.‚Äù

original: de ni mi gus pa dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de ni mi gus pa dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of supporting lack of respect and the arising of suffering.

original: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang / gang zag yon tan can rnams la 'gying zhing lus dang ngag gi sri zhu med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gus pa ni bla ma rnams dang / gang zag yon tan can rnams la 'gying zhing lus dang ngag gi sri zhu med pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect is the lack of physical and verbal deference to gurus and virtuous persons.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni 'dir yang srid pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba ni 'dir yang srid pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of suffering means the arising of future existence.

original: de ni sems nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor bye brag med kyang sems khengs pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun du tha dad de /
analyzed: de ni sems nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor bye brag med kyang sems khengs pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun du tha dad de /
translated: Although pride is not different in its own nature as the inflation of the mind, it is differentiated as seven types according to the specific causes of the inflation of the mind.

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are pride, excessive pride, etc.

original: rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas dma' babs kyang rigs dang shes rgya dang nor rnams kyis bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas dma' babs kyang rigs dang shes rgya dang nor rnams kyis bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: Even if one is inferior in terms of lineage, knowledge, wealth, etc., the inflation of mind which thinks, I am greater than he is in terms of lineage, knowledge, wealth, etc., or

original: rigs la sogs pas mtshungs pa nyid la bdag dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs ba gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pas mtshungs pa nyid la bdag dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs ba gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: the inflation of mind which thinks, I am equal to him when one is equal to another in terms of lineage, etc., is pride.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pa mtshungs ba bas gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pa mtshungs ba bas gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam pa'am /
translated: Exaggerated pride is the inflation of mind which thinks, I am greater than he is in terms of generosity, morality, and courage, when one is equal to another in terms of lineage, knowledge, wealth, etc., or

original: rigs dang nor dang rigs pa la sogs pas che ba la shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas bdag mtshungs so snyam pa ste /
analyzed: rigs dang nor dang rigs pa la sogs pas che ba la shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas bdag mtshungs so snyam pa ste /
translated: the inflation of mind which thinks, I am equal to him in terms of knowledge, wealth, etc., when one is inferior to another in terms of lineage, wealth, and reason.

original: 'di ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is exaggerated pride.

original: rigs dang shes rgya dang nor rnams kyi che ba bas kyang rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa 'di ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: rigs dang shes rgya dang nor rnams kyi che ba bas kyang rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa 'di ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride that thinks, I am great because of my family, knowledge, and wealth, and is inflated by this thought.

original: nga'o @158b snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nga'o @158b snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The pride that thinks I am is the inflation of the mind that comes from clinging to the five aggregates that are appropriated as I and mine, although they are devoid of I and mine.

original: 'di ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride that thinks I am.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya bar thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya bar thob par bdag gis thob po snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The pride of thinking I am superior is the inflation of the mind that thinks, I have attained what is to be attained, with regard to the special attainments of those who are superior.

original: 'di ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride of thinking I am superior.üîΩ üîΩI am is the pride of thinking I am in regard to the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang rigs pa la sogs pas khyed che bar 'phags pa bas rigs dang rigs pa la sogs pas cung zad cig gis bdag chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang rigs pa la sogs pas khyed che bar 'phags pa bas rigs dang rigs pa la sogs pas cung zad cig gis bdag chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The pride of thinking I am a little bit is the inflation of the mind which thinks, I am a little bit inferior to those who are superior to me in clan, knowledge, etc.

original: 'di ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride of thinking I am a little bit.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The pride of wrong-vanity is the inflation of the mind which thinks, I have good qualities, when one does not have good qualities.

original: 'di ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
