analyzed: 'di ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride of wrong-vanity.

original: yon tan ma yin pa ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
translated: Bad qualities are immorality, etc.

original: de dag su la yod pa de yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag su la yod pa de yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who has them is said to have bad qualities.

original: de bas na bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa des sbyin ba dang tshul khrims la sogs pa med bar yon tan de dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa des sbyin ba dang tshul khrims la sogs pa med bar yon tan de dang ldan pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the one who thinks, I have good qualities, by that very fact admits that he has no good qualities such as generosity and morality.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med bas na log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med bas na log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is non-existent as a thing, it is called a false pride.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni spyir bshad du zin kyang nyon mongs par gtogs pas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid lnga kho na ste /
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni spyir bshad du zin kyang nyon mongs par gtogs pas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid lnga kho na ste /
translated: Although the word ‚Äúview‚Äù has been explained in general, only five of them are of the nature of defilement, because they belong to the defilements.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba dang sbyar gyi 'jig rten gyi yang dag par lta ba dang / zag pa med ba'i lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lta ba dang sbyar gyi 'jig rten gyi yang dag par lta ba dang / zag pa med ba'i lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are associated with the views such as the view of the perishable constituents, but not with the correct worldly view or the uncontaminated view.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can dang / rtog pa'i tshul du bye brag med kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad do //üîΩde la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la gang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'o //üîΩmthar 'dzin par lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la bdag tu bzung ba de dag nyid la gang chad pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can dang / rtog pa'i tshul du bye brag med kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad do // de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la gang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'o // mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po la bdag tu bzung ba de dag nyid la gang chad pa'am /
translated: Although they are not differentiated in terms of being defiled or conceptual, they are mutually differentiated by the differentiation of their objects and aspects.üîΩAmong them, the view of the perishable constituents is the view of the five appropriated aggregates as a self and as what belongs to a self.

original: rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of holding to an extreme is the view that what is appropriated as a self, i.e., the five aggregates, is either annihilated or eternal.

original: log par lta ba ni lta ba gang gi rgyu'am 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni lta ba gang gi rgyu'am 'bras bu'am /
translated: Wrong view is the view that is the cause or result ofüîΩthe other views.

original: byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'am /
analyzed: byed pa la skur pa 'debs pa'am /
translated: Wrong views are the denial of the cause, effect, or activity of a view,

original: dngos po yod pa 'jig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa 'jig par byed pa ste /
translated: or the denial of the existence of a thing.

original: 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi nang na sdig pa yin pas log par lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩlta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po @159a * //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba thams cad kyi nang na sdig pa yin pas log par lta ba zhes bya'o // lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po @159a * //
translated: They are called wrong views because they are the most sinful of all views.

original: rnams la mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang gtso bo dang dam par lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnams la mchog dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang gtso bo dang dam par lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The overesteeming of views is the belief that the five appropriative aggregates are supreme, excellent, distinguished, or foremost.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byin par lta ba'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices is the belief that the five appropriative aggregates are pure, liberated, or a means of release.

original: the tshom ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid gnyis za ba ste /
translated: Doubt is uncertainty about actions and their results, the truths, and the jewels.

original: yod dam med snyam du blo sna tshogs byed pa ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: yod dam med snyam du blo sna tshogs byed pa ni yid gnyis so //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty about whether or not things exist.

original: 'di ni shes rab las rang bzhin gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab las rang bzhin gzhan nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of anger that is different from wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa drug bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug bshad zin to /
translated: The six root afflictions have been explained.

original: // / kham po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: // / kham po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: This is the second, final chapter.

original: de'i 'og tu bstan pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad pa'i phyir /üîΩkhro dang khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'chab dang 'tshig dang phrag dog dang // ser sna dang ni sgyur bcas dang // g-yo rgyags rnam 'tshe ngo tsha med //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bstan pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams bshad pa'i phyir / khro dang khon du 'dzin pa dang // 'chab dang 'tshig dang phrag dog dang // ser sna dang ni sgyur bcas dang // g-yo rgyags rnam 'tshe ngo tsha med //
translated: Next, in order to explain the secondary afflictions, it is said:

original: khrel med rmugs dang rgod pa dang // ma dad pa dang le lo dang // bag med pa dang brjed ngas dang // rnam g-yengs shes bzhin ma yin dang // 'gyod dang gnyid kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: khrel med rmugs dang rgod pa dang // ma dad pa dang le lo dang // bag med pa dang brjed ngas dang // rnam g-yengs shes bzhin ma yin dang // 'gyod dang gnyid kyang de bzhin te //
translated: Anger, resentment, concealment, spite, envy, stinginess, deceit, fraud, arrogance, intoxication, violence, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, lethargy, excitation, lack of faith, laziness, carelessness, forgetfulness, distraction, lack of introspection, regret, and sleepiness,

original: rtog pa dang ni dpyod pa dang // nye ba'i nyon mongs gnyis rnam gnyis //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ni dpyod pa dang // nye ba'i nyon mongs gnyis rnam gnyis // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: as well as investigation and analysis, are the two types of secondary afflictions.

original: de la khro ba ni 'phral du gnod pa byed pa gnas te /
analyzed: de la khro ba ni 'phral du gnod pa byed pa gnas te /
translated: Here, anger is the immediate harm-doer.

original: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mental state of complete malice.üîΩResentment is the continuation of anger.

original: 'di yang kun nas mnar sems kyi rang bzhin yin bas khong khro ba dang tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi 'di ni khong khro ba'i dus skabs kyi bye brag la btags pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang kun nas mnar sems kyi rang bzhin yin bas khong khro ba dang tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi 'di ni khong khro ba'i dus skabs kyi bye brag la btags pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: Since this also has the nature of complete affliction, it is not different from anger. However, since it is designated in a specific instance of anger, it is a part of anger.

original: 'phral du gnod par byed pa la gnas nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'phral du gnod par byed pa la gnas nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: It is the complete affliction of the mind that abides in the object of harming another, whether a sentient being or not.

original: chad pas gcod pa la sogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can gang yin pa de khro ba zhes gdags so //
analyzed: chad pas gcod pa la sogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can gang yin pa de khro ba zhes gdags so //
translated: It is designated as wrath, and its function is to support punishment and so on.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Resentment is the holding of a grudge.

original: khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes mdud par 'dzin ba'i bdag nyid shar gnyer ba de mi gtong bar rgyun du 'byung ba ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes mdud par 'dzin ba'i bdag nyid shar gnyer ba de mi gtong bar rgyun du 'byung ba ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: After anger, it is the holding of a grudge that thinks, ‚ÄúThis person harmed me,‚Äù and it is the continuous occurrence of not letting go of that grudge.

original: 'di ni mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bzod pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support intolerance.

original: mi bzod pa ni gnod pa byed ba la ji mi snyam par mi byed kyi lan du gnod pa byed 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni gnod pa byed ba la ji mi snyam par mi byed kyi lan du gnod pa byed 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Non-forbearance is not to be indifferent to harm done to oneself, but to wish to return harm in return.

original: 'di yang khro ba bzhin du zhe @159b sdang gi dus skabs kyi bye brag la gdags pa yin pas de'i phyir btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khro ba bzhin du zhe @159b sdang gi dus skabs kyi bye brag la gdags pa yin pas de'i phyir btags pa'i yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is also a designation for a particular occasion of anger, just like anger. Therefore, it should be understood as a nominal existent.

original: 'chab pa ni bdag gi kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa ste /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni bdag gi kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa ste /
translated: Concealment is to hide one's own faults.

original: 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa bstsal te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa bstsal te /
translated: It is a mental factor that, due to desire, hatred, fear, etc.,

original: de la phan par 'dod ba'i gleng bar byed pas dus su khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bstan na gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan par 'dod ba'i gleng bar byed pas dus su khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bstan na gti mug gi char gtogs pas kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
translated: conceals one's faults when questioned by those who wish to benefit oneself. When they ask, Why have you done such a thing? one conceals one's faults by a part of delusion.

original: 'chab pa ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Concealment is a part of delusion.

original: mkhyud pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhyud pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a form of delusion.

original: 'di ni 'gyod pa dang reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyod pa dang reg par mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support regret and lack of serenity.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: de kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa na 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa na 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one conceals a misdeed, one feels remorse.

original: 'gyod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas reg par mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'gyod na gdon mi za bar yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur bas reg par mi gnas so //
translated: When one feels remorse, one is certainly accompanied by mental dissatisfaction. Thus, one does not remain in a state of ease.

original: 'tshig pa ni tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do //
translated: Spite is the state of one who is given to harsh and cutting speech.

original: 'tshig brlang po ni mtshang 'dru ba'i tshul gyis zhe gcod pa dang / tshig rtsub pa'o //üîΩzher 'debs par byed pa'i dang tshul ni zher 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: 'tshig brlang po ni mtshang 'dru ba'i tshul gyis zhe gcod pa dang / tshig rtsub pa'o // zher 'debs par byed pa'i dang tshul ni zher 'debs pa ste /
translated: Harsh and cutting speech is speech that is offensive, like the piercing of a boil.

original: de'i dngos po ni zher 'debs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni zher 'debs pa nyid do //
translated: The state of one who is given to harsh and cutting speech is the nature of being given to harsh and cutting speech.

original: tshig brlang pos za ba dang 'dra bar zher 'debs pas tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshig brlang pos za ba dang 'dra bar zher 'debs pas tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do //
translated: It is like a person who devours with harsh and cutting speech.

original: 'di yang khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid do //üîΩrdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i rang bzhin yin pas khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa nyid do //üîΩrdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is also included in anger, because it is by nature a mental grievance that is preceded by anger and envy.

original: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa skyed pa'i las can dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa skyed pa'i las can dang / reg par mi gnas pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to generate verbal misconduct and to make one unapproachable.

original: de dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa'i gang zag dang 'grogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to associate with a person who possesses these.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs bal sems khong nas 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs bal sems khong nas 'khrug pa ste /
translated: Jealousy is an internal disturbance of mind that is discontent with another's success.

original: 'thob pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad bar mthong nas zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa mi bzod par bya ba'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa ni phrag dog go //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rigs dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad bar mthong nas zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa mi bzod par bya ba'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa ni phrag dog go //
translated: It is an internal disturbance of mind that is discontent with another's success, which is a part of hatred. It is discontent with another's gain, honor, family, ethical discipline, learning, and so on, when one is attached to one's own gain, honor, and so on.

original: rang gi gnas la khyab par 'khrug pas khong nas 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi gnas la khyab par 'khrug pas khong nas 'khrug pa ste /
translated: It is an internal disturbance because it disturbs one's own state.

original: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir reg par mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir reg par mi gnas pa ste /
translated: It is unapproachable because it is concomitant with mental dissatisfaction and because it precedes that.

original: yid mi bde ba dang reg par mi gnas pa'i las @160a * //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang reg par mi gnas pa'i las @160a * //
translated: It is the karma of not being happy and not being comfortable.

original: can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the action of dissatisfaction and of not remaining in contact.

original: ser sna ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa'o //üîΩzin pa'i dngos po chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid rnams gang gis mchod ba dang phan gdags par 'dod pas 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa'o // zin pa'i dngos po chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa'i bdag nyid rnams gang gis mchod ba dang phan gdags par 'dod pas 'dod pa'am /
translated: Avarice is the grasping of the mind that is contrary to giving.

original: mi 'dod pa la'ang rung ste /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa la'ang rung ste /
translated: It is the desire of one who, by nature, is generous, to honor and benefit those who are virtuous and those who are in need, whether they are loved or not.

original: sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the relinquishing of that which is grasped by the mind.

original: de yod na sbyin pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yod na sbyin pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called contrary to avarice because it does not exist when avarice exists.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa dang yongs su mi gtong ba'i /
translated: Avarice is the grasping and non-relinquishing of the mind that is associated with attachment to the necessities of life, due to excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: 'dod pa ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni ser sna'o //
translated: It is the desire to possess.

original: de ni yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: de ni yo byad ma bsnyungs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: It has the function of supporting the non-abandonment of necessities.

original: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang stsogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad ma bsnyungs pa ni ser snas yo byad mi mkho ba rnams kyang stsogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Lack of modesty is the lack of embarrassment about one's own faults.

original: sgyu ni gzhan la bslu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ni gzhan la bslu ba'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa ste /
translated: Deceit is the display of what is unreal for the purpose of deceiving others.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la bslu ba'i bsam pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la bslu ba'i bsam pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa ste /
translated: It is the intention to deceive others through attachment to gain and honor, and to display oneself to others in a way that is different from the way one actually is, through pretending to have morality, etc.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags dang gti mug 'dus pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston pas na de gnyis 'dus pa la gdags te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang gti mug 'dus pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston pas na de gnyis 'dus pa la gdags te /
translated: It is imputed to the combination of attachment and delusion, since it displays unreal good qualities.

original: khro ba la sogs pa bzhin du gdags pa nyid yin gyi rdzas su ni med de /
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa bzhin du gdags pa nyid yin gyi rdzas su ni med de /
translated: It is imputed, not substantially existent, like anger, etc.

original: log pas 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: log pas 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support wrong livelihood.

original: g-yo ni rang gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni rang gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ba ste /
translated: Slyness is the holding of a method to conceal one's faults.

original: sems gya gyu ba'o //
analyzed: sems gya gyu ba'o //
translated: It is a crooked mind.

original: rang gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs ni gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs ni gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pa ste /
translated: The method to conceal one's faults is to confuse others.

original: de yang gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba dang / gtam rlung la skur ba dang / gsal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan nas gzhan du bsgyur ba dang / gtam rlung la skur ba dang / gsal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is also a transformation of one thing into another, a casting of aspersions, and a lack of clarity.

original: de'i phyir g-yo dang 'chab pa gnyis tha dad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yo dang 'chab pa gnyis tha dad de /
translated: Thus, deceit and dissimulation are different.

original: de ni gsal por mkhyud kyi zur gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gsal por mkhyud kyi zur gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The former is a concealing of one's faults by a crooked mind, but not by implication.

original: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas 'dod chags dang gti mug de gnyis kyis bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i phyir gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pas de gnyis 'dus pa las de gdags so //
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags nas 'dod chags dang gti mug de gnyis kyis bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i phyir gzhan mgo rmongs par byed pas de gnyis 'dus pa las de gdags so //
translated: The latter is a concealing of one's faults by both desire and delusion, when one is attached to gain and honor. Both of them are designated as a transformation of one thing into another because they deceive others.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct the acquisition of true instruction.

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni gang rnyed na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni gang rnyed na tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: When one acquires true instruction, one reflects properly.

original: de'i bar @160b chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bar @160b chad byed pa'o //
translated: It obstructs that.

original: rgyags pa ni bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: Conceit is an inflated state of mind that is attached to one's own excellences.

original: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is a grasping at the mind.

original: rigs dang nad med pa dang lang tsho dang stobs dang gzugs dang / phyug pa dang blo dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'o //üîΩrab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag ste /üîΩdga' ba'i bye brag gang gis sems rang dbang med par byed ba des de dag gi dbang du byed pas yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te /üîΩde'i phyir sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rigs dang nad med pa dang lang tsho dang stobs dang gzugs dang / phyug pa dang blo dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa ni rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'o // rab tu dga' ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag ste / dga' ba'i bye brag gang gis sems rang dbang med par byed ba des de dag gi dbang du byed pas yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur te / de'i phyir sems yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The best of one's own excellence is the best of one's own excellence of lineage, health, youth, strength, form, wealth, intellect, and memory.üîΩJoy is a particular kind of delight.üîΩBy that particular kind of delight which makes the mind uncontrollable, they are brought under one's control, and thus one is said to hold the mind.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //üîΩrnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /üîΩbsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa dang / sdig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams la 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i las can no //üîΩrnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /üîΩbsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa dang / sdig pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams la 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //

original: 'dis bsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis bsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o //
translated: It is violence toward sentient beings because it generates suffering and mental dissatisfaction in sentient beings by killing, binding, and so on.

original: de ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni khong khro ba'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: It is a part of anger.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje med cing sems rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje med cing sems rtsub pa'o //
translated: It is a lack of compassion toward sentient beings and a harshness of mind.

original: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i las can ni rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i las can ni rnam par 'tshe ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Its action is to be violent toward sentient beings.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi 'dzem pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of self-respect.

original: las de dag gi cha ma yin par shes bzhin du yang gang kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa de ni ngo tsha med pa ste /
analyzed: las de dag gi cha ma yin par shes bzhin du yang gang kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa de ni ngo tsha med pa ste /
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of self-respect that occurs when one knows that one is doing something wrong but does it anyway.

original: ngo tsha shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of shame.

original: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho ba gzhan la mi 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho ba gzhan la mi 'dzem pa ste /
translated: Lack of embarrassment is the lack of respect for others.

analyzed: slong ba'i dngos po ni slong ba nyid de /üîΩde dang ldan na sems blun par gyur nas slong bar gyur te /
translated: They are called roots

original: dmigs pa rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is the inability to understand the object.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its activity is to assist all passions and secondary passions.

original: gti mug gi cha la btags pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid yin gyi gud na med do //
analyzed: gti mug gi cha la btags pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid yin gyi gud na med do //
translated: Since it is a part of delusion, it is categorized as a part of delusion and does not exist separately.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Excitement is an agitation of mind.

original: rnam par zhi ba ni zhi gnas te /
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba ni zhi gnas te /
translated: Tranquility is calm,

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: and that which is contrary to it is agitation.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang mthun pa sngon dgod dgod pa dang dga' dga' ba dang / rtse rtse ba rjes su dran nas sems rnam par ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang mthun pa sngon dgod dgod pa dang dga' dga' ba dang / rtse rtse ba rjes su dran nas sems rnam par ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: It is a cause of agitation of mind, since it recalls previous laughter, joy, and play that were consistent with passion.

original: zhig nas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: zhig nas kyi bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to obstruct serenity.

original: ma dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la mngon par yid ma ches pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la mngon par yid ma ches pa ste /
translated: Lack of faith is a lack of conviction regarding actions, their results, the truths, and the Three Jewels.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the opposite of faith.

original: dad pa ni yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang pa dang 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la mngon par yid ches pa dang / dang pa dang 'dod pa ste /
translated: Faith is a clear conviction, a clarity, and a desire with regard to that which exists, that which possesses good qualities, and that which is possible.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is, respectively,

original: ma dad pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Lack of faith is the opposite of that.

original: yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la mngon par yid mi ches pa dang ma dad pa dang mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang yon tan can dang nus pa rnams la mngon par yid mi ches pa dang ma dad pa dang mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is a lack of clear conviction, a lack of clarity, and a lack of desire with regard to that which exists, that which possesses good qualities, and that which is possible.

original: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its activity is to support laziness.

original: ma dad pa ni spyir ba la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can nyid do //
analyzed: ma dad pa ni spyir ba la 'dun pa med pa'i phyir le lo'i rten byed pa'i las can nyid do //
translated: Lack of faith is the support of laziness because it is a lack of desire in general.

original: lo lo ni dge ba la sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
analyzed: lo lo ni dge ba la sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
translated: Laziness is the lack of delight in virtue.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the adversary of effort.

original: nyal ba dang sces  pa dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyal ba dang sces  pa dang 'phres pa'i bde ba la brten nas gti mug gi char gtogs pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of delight in virtuous actions of body, speech, and mind, which is a part of delusion, because it is based on the pleasure of lying down, sitting, and so on.

original: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct the practice of virtue.

original: bag med pa ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo gang yin pa dag gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa las sems mi srung ba dang / de'i gnyen por gyur pa dge ba la mi sgom pa ste /
analyzed: bag med pa ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo gang yin pa dag gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa las sems mi srung ba dang / de'i gnyen por gyur pa dge ba la mi sgom pa ste /
translated: Negligence is the failure to guard the mind against attachment, hatred, and ignorance due to any attachment, hatred, ignorance, or laziness, and the noncultivation of virtue which is the antidote to those.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo dag la bag med pa gdags so //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang le lo dag la bag med pa gdags so //
translated: Negligence is imputed in regard to attachment, hatred, ignorance, and laziness.

original: 'di ni mi dge ba 'phel ba dang / dge ba 'grib @161b ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi dge ba 'phel ba dang / dge ba 'grib @161b ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support the increase of nonvirtue and the decrease of virtue.

original: brjed ngas pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: Forgetfulness is afflicted mindfulness.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan ba'o //
translated: Afflicted means associated with the afflictions.

original: 'di ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind that is included in attachment, hostility, and confusion.

original: 'dis sems sna tshogs su g-yeng bar byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis sems sna tshogs su g-yeng bar byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: It is distraction because it scatters the mind in various ways.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gang dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa las phyi rol du g-yeng bar byed pa de dag la ji ltar mthun mthun du rnam par g-yeng ba gdags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gang dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa las phyi rol du g-yeng bar byed pa de dag la ji ltar mthun mthun du rnam par g-yeng ba gdags so //
translated: Distraction is designated according to the attachment, hostility, and confusion by which the mind is distracted externally from the object of concentration.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to obstruct freedom from attachment.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Lack of awareness is the wisdom associated with the passions.

original: des 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi spyod pa mi shes bzhin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: des 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi spyod pa mi shes bzhin du 'jug ste /
translated: By it, one engages in the conduct of body, speech, and mind in going, returning, and so on, without being aware of it.

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas ltung ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to support downfalls, because one does not know what should and should not be done.

original: 'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: Regret is remorse.

original: smad pa byas pas 'gyod do //
analyzed: smad pa byas pas 'gyod do //
translated: One regrets what one has done badly.

original: de'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Its nature is that of regret.

original: 'dir ni ngan pa byas pa'i yul la sems mi dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ngan pa byas pa'i yul la sems mi dga' ba ste /
translated: Here, it is a mental dissatisfaction with regard to an object that one has done badly.

original: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i skabs yin pas 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is a section on mental factors, it is called regret.

original: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems gnas pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to obstruct the stability of mind.

original: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the contraction of the mind that occurs involuntarily.

original: 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Contraction is the mind's engagement with an object.

original: de yang sems kyi rang dbang med pa gang las byung ba de gnyid do //
analyzed: de yang sems kyi rang dbang med pa gang las byung ba de gnyid do //
translated: It is sleep from which the mind's involuntary occurrence arises.

original: yang na lus 'dzin mi nus pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de gang las byung ba de gnyid do //
analyzed: yang na lus 'dzin mi nus pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa rang dbang med pa de gang las byung ba de gnyid do //
translated: Or, it is sleep from which the involuntary contraction of the mind that is unable to hold the body arises.

original: sems sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems sdud pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The contraction of the mind is its nonengagement through the doors of the eye and so on.

original: de ni gti mug gi cha la gdags pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni gti mug gi cha la gdags pas gti mug gi char gtogs pa ste /
translated: Since it is designated as a part of delusion, it belongs to delusion.

original: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: bya ba shor ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Its action is to support the loss of activity.

original: rtog pa ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization is mental expression that is investigation.

original: shes rab dang sems pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: shes rab dang sems pa'i bye brag go //
translated: It is a type of wisdom and thought.

original: kun du tshol ba ni 'di ci yin zhes rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: kun du tshol ba ni 'di ci yin zhes rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the entry of thought into the question, ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: yid la brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yid la brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa ste /
translated: Mental expression is the expression of thought.

original: brjod pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like expression.

original: brjod pa ni don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni don brjod pa'o //
translated: Expression is the expression of meaning.

original: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la sems pa ni gang sems kun du g-yo @162a * //üîΩbar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag ces bya ba la sems pa ni gang sems kun du g-yo @162a * // bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: A type of thought and wisdom. Thought is that which has the nature of causing the mind to move.

original: shes rab ni yon tan dang nyes pa 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni yon tan dang nyes pa 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Wisdom is the aspect of distinguishing good qualities and faults.

original: de'i dbang gis sems 'jug pas ni bar 'ga' ni sems dang sems la rtog pa gdags so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems 'jug pas ni bar 'ga' ni sems dang sems la rtog pa gdags so //
translated: Because the mind engages by the power of that, sometimes thought is designated to the mind and mental factors.

original: bar 'ga' ni shes rab dang sems la gdags te /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni shes rab dang sems la gdags te /
translated: Sometimes it is designated to wisdom and thought.

original: mngon bar mi rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon bar mi rtogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is in accordance with the times of non-realization and realization.

original: yang na sems ba dang shes rab gnyis kho na la rtogs pa gdags te /
analyzed: yang na sems ba dang shes rab gnyis kho na la rtogs pa gdags te /
translated: Or else, only thought and discernment are designated as understanding,

original: de'i dbang gis sems de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems de ltar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind engages in that way under the influence of those two.

original: de nyid sems rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems rtsing ba'o //
translated: That itself is coarse thought.

original: rtsing ba zhes bya ba ni che long ste /
analyzed: rtsing ba zhes bya ba ni che long ste /
translated: What is called coarse is gross,

original: dngos po tsam kun du tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam kun du tshol ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the aspect of seeking the mere entity.

original: tshul 'di ni dpyod pa la yang ba lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni dpyod pa la yang ba lta bar bya'o //
translated: This method should be seen as also applying to investigation.

original: dpyod pa yang sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dpyod pa yang sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Investigation also has the nature of a distinction of thought and discernment.

original: so sor rtog pa'i yid kyi brjod pa nyid de sngar khong du chud pa la 'di'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i yid kyi brjod pa nyid de sngar khong du chud pa la 'di'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the verbalization of the discerning mind, because it verbalizes what was previously understood, saying, ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sems zhi ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde gnyis ni reg par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems zhi ba zhes bya'o // de gnyis ni reg par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Therefore, it is called a subtle mind.üîΩThose two have the function of supporting the contact that remains and the contact that does not remain.

original: 'di gnyis ni rtsing ba dang zhib par rnam par gnas pas tha dad du dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rtsing ba dang zhib par rnam par gnas pas tha dad du dbye ba'o //
translated: These two are distinguished as coarse and subtle.

original: gnyis rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis gnyis pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyis rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis gnyis pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútwo pairs and two‚Äù refers to two pairs and two individual factors.

original: de dag ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis so //
translated: They are the two factors of regret and sleep, and the two factors of initial mental application and subsequent discursive thought.

original: chos de bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos de bzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These four factors are of two types:

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: afflicted and unafflicted.

original: de la mi dge ba ma byas te dge ba byas pas sems mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba ma byas te dge ba byas pas sems mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Among them, regret that is an afflicted mental factor is that which arises from not having done what is virtuous and from having done what is nonvirtuous.

original: gang dge ba ma byas te mi dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang dge ba ma byas te mi dge ba byas pas 'gyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Regret that is not afflicted is that which arises from having done what is virtuous and from not having done what is nonvirtuous.

original: gnyid kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'phangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'phangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can no nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sleep is defiled when it is projected by a defiled mind and associated with a defiled mind; it is not defiled when it is projected by an undefiled mind and associated with an undefiled mind.

original: 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa can no //üîΩmngon bar 'byung ba la sogs pa la rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du gzhan la gnod pa bya ba'i thabs dpyod pa ni @162b nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa can no // mngon bar 'byung ba la sogs pa la rtog pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin no // de bzhin du gzhan la gnod pa bya ba'i thabs dpyod pa ni @162b nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The defiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire, malice, and violence.üîΩThe undefiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire for sense-pleasures, malice, violence, and the view that one is superior.üîΩThe defiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire for sense-pleasures, malice, violence, and the view that one is superior.üîΩThe undefiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire for sense-pleasures, malice, violence, and the view that one is superior.üîΩThe defiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire for sense-pleasures, malice, violence, and the view that one is superior.

original: gzhan la phan gdags pa'i thabs dpyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan gdags pa'i thabs dpyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The undefiled mind is that which is associated with the defilements of desire for sense-pleasures, malice, violence, and the view that one is superior.

original: de la 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa nyon mongs pa can de dag nyid nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa nyon mongs pa can de dag nyid nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Regret, sleep, investigation, and analysis that are afflicted are afflictions.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no //
translated: The others are not.

original: de la ji ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam pa drug po dag kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / bye brag tu nges pa rnams dang / dge ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi nang nas ci rigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa rnam pa drug po dag kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / bye brag tu nges pa rnams dang / dge ba rnams dang / nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi nang nas ci rigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the six types of objects such as form and sound are concomitant with the omnipresent mental factors, the specific mental factors, the virtuous mental factors, the afflicted mental factors, the branch afflictions, and all the mental factors as appropriate, so too

original: tshor ba gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum ste /
translated: there are three feelings:

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ste /
translated: the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, and the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: They are concomitant with the three types of feeling.

original: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi gzugs la sogs pa las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi gnas kyi gzugs la sogs pa las de 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from form, etc. that is the basis of pleasure, displeasure, and indifference.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun du 'gro ba lnga po kho na dang mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun du 'gro ba lnga po kho na dang mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: The store-consciousness is associated only with the five omnipresent factors,

original: gzhan dag dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with others.

original: de la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid de /
analyzed: de la tshor ba btang snyoms nyid de /
translated: Among them, the feeling is only indifference.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is unobscured and undefined.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni kun du 'gro ba lnga dang / bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni kun du 'gro ba lnga dang / bdag tu rmongs pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The defiled mind is always associated with the five omnipresent factors, the four defilements, delusion about self, etc.,

original: de la yang tshor ba ni btang snyoms nyid de /
analyzed: de la yang tshor ba ni btang snyoms nyid de /
translated: and among them, the feeling is only indifference.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: It is obscured and undefined.

original: de ni 'di bsam par bya ste ci mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga po dag cig car dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gcig 'byung gi / gnyis dang mang po mi 'byung ste /üîΩji ltar kha cig sems pa cig car gnyis dang mang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di bsam par bya ste ci mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga po dag cig car dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gcig 'byung gi / gnyis dang mang po mi 'byung ste / ji ltar kha cig sems pa cig car gnyis dang mang po ma yin te /
translated: This should be considered: If the five such as eye consciousness simultaneously encounter objective conditions, only one arises from the foundation consciousness, not two or many.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some think that two or more do not arise simultaneously because without a immediately preceding condition, only one consciousness arises.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gis mang po'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed bar mi nus so snyam pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gis mang po'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed bar mi nus so snyam pa lta bu'am /
translated: One consciousness cannot act as the immediately preceding condition for many.

original: 'on te nges pa med de gal te gcig gi rkyen dang phrad na gcig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa med de gal te gcig gi rkyen dang phrad na gcig 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Or do they arise without certainty? If the condition for one arises, one arises.

original: de bzhin du gnyis dang mang po'i rkyen dang phrad na gnyis dang mang po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis dang mang po'i rkyen dang phrad na gnyis dang mang po yang 'byung bar 'gyur ram snyam pa la /
translated: If the condition for two or many arises, two or many arise?

original: de'i phyir @163a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @163a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: lnga rnams rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
analyzed: lnga rnams rtsa ba'i rnam shes las //
translated: the five arise from the root consciousness.

original: ji lta'i rkyen las byung ba ni //
analyzed: ji lta'i rkyen las byung ba ni //
translated: Arisen from the condition of that,

original: rnam shes lhan cig gam ma yin //
analyzed: rnam shes lhan cig gam ma yin //
translated: consciousness is either simultaneous or not.

original: chu las rlabs rnams ji bzhin no //
analyzed: chu las rlabs rnams ji bzhin no //
translated: Like waves from water.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: lnga rnams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: lnga rnams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams par shes pa rnams te /
translated: The five are the eye, etc., consciousnesses,

original: de'i rjes su rgyu ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rgyu ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: along with the mental consciousness that accompanies them.

original: lnga po rnams kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pas de las byung ba dang / 'gro ba rnams su skye ba nye bar len pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyi sa bon gyi gnas yin pas de las byung ba dang / 'gro ba rnams su skye ba nye bar len pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The store consciousness is called the root consciousness because it is the seed-state of the five, and because it appropriates birth in the destinies.

original: ji lta'i rkyen las zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi rkyen dang phrad pa de dang de nges par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji lta'i rkyen las zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gi rkyen dang phrad pa de dang de nges par 'byung ste /
translated: Arisen from the condition of that means that whatever condition it encounters, that arises.

original: 'byung ba ni bdag thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni bdag thob pa'o //
translated: Arising means obtaining a self.

original: lhan cig gam ma yin zhes bya ba ni cig car ram rim gyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig gam ma yin zhes bya ba ni cig car ram rim gyis so //
translated: Either simultaneously or not means either instantaneously or gradually.

original: chu la rlabs rnams ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car ram cig car ma yin par 'gyur ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: chu la rlabs rnams ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa cig car ram cig car ma yin par 'gyur ba'i dpe ste /
translated: Just as waves arise in water is an example of how the consciousnesses that engage objects arise from the foundation consciousness, either simultaneously or not simultaneously.üîΩAs the Sutra of Vast Wisdom says:

original: ji skad du blo gros yangs pa dper na chu bo'i chu rgyun du 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs gcig 'byung ngo //üîΩgal te gnyis sam gsum mam /
analyzed: ji skad du blo gros yangs pa dper na chu bo'i chu rgyun du 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na rlabs gcig 'byung ngo // gal te gnyis sam gsum mam /
translated: For example, in a river flowing downstream, if the conditions for a single wave arise, then a single wave occurs.

original: rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang rlabs mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: rlabs mang po 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang rlabs mang po 'byung ste /
translated: If the conditions for two, three, or many waves arise, then many waves occur.

original: chu bo'i chu rgyun yang chad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chu bo'i chu rgyun yang chad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The flow of the river is not interrupted and does not appear to be exhausted.

original: yongs su zad par yang mi mngon pa de bzhin du blo gros yangs pa chu bo de'i gnas lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun du brten cing rab tu gnas nas gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la gcig pu 'byung ba'i rkyen nye
analyzed: yongs su zad par yang mi mngon pa de bzhin du blo gros yangs pa chu bo de'i gnas lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun du brten cing rab tu gnas nas gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la gcig pu 'byung ba'i rkyen nye
translated: In the same way, Vast Wisdom, if the conditions for the occurrence of a single eye consciousness arise, then a single eye consciousness occurs.

original: bar gnas par gyur na mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig pu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bar gnas par gyur na mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig pu 'byung ngo //
translated: When it is neutral, only visual consciousness arises.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam lnga 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang gnyis sam gsum mam lnga'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa gnyis sam gsum mam lnga 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang gnyis sam gsum mam lnga'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs ba lta bu'o //
translated: If the conditions for the arising of two, three, or five consciousnesses are present, then two, three, or five arise.

original: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle,

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab //üîΩbdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo bzhin du 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: all seeds flowing in it like a river.

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: Fearing the idea of a self, I do not teach it to the immature.

original: zhe'o // rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni mi @163b 'dod de /
analyzed: zhe'o // rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni mi @163b 'dod de /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is not accepted as being as specific as the objective condition of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung ba de rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du khas len pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad 'byung ba de rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du khas len pas /
translated: Because it is accepted that all consciousnesses arise as the immediately preceding condition of all consciousnesses.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig pu de las kyang rnam par shes pa gnyis sam mang po 'byung ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig pu de las kyang rnam par shes pa gnyis sam mang po 'byung ste /
translated: If it encounters the objective condition, then many or two consciousnesses arise from that immediately preceding condition alone.

original: 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: gang de ma thag pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa med pa la lnga po rnams cig car dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad kyang gcig kho na la 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang de ma thag pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa med pa la lnga po rnams cig car dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad kyang gcig kho na la 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the five sense consciousnesses do not have a specific immediately preceding condition, then even if they encounter the objective condition simultaneously, only one arises, not all five.

original: lnga char ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod /üîΩde lta bas na dmigs pa yod na lnga char 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: lnga char ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod / de lta bas na dmigs pa yod na lnga char 'byung ba'am /
translated: What is the reason that only one arises?

original: yang na mi 'byung bar khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: yang na mi 'byung bar khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if the objective condition exists, it is necessary to accept that all five arise or that none arise.

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /üîΩci yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag dang lhan cig 'byung ngam /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste / ci yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag dang lhan cig 'byung ngam /
translated: Now this should be stated:

original: 'on te de dag med kyang 'byung snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te de dag med kyang 'byung snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Does mental consciousness occur simultaneously with eye consciousness and so on, or does it occur even when they do not exist?

original: yid kyi rnam shes 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes 'byung ba ni //
translated: Mental consciousness occurs

original: rtag tu'o 'du shes med pa dang // snyoms bar 'jug pa rnam gnyis dang // sems med gnyid dang brgyal ma gtogs //
analyzed: rtag tu'o 'du shes med pa dang // snyoms bar 'jug pa rnam gnyis dang // sems med gnyid dang brgyal ma gtogs //
translated: always, except for the two mindless states, sleep, and fainting.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad de /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad de /
translated: Always means at all times.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa dang de ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa dang de ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Together with the eye consciousness, etc., and not together with them is what is meant.

original: phyir btang ba 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba rtsom ste /
analyzed: phyir btang ba 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba rtsom ste /
translated: The exception to this is begun:

original: 'du shes med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis dang / sems med gnyid dang brgyal ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis dang / sems med gnyid dang brgyal ma gtogs //
translated: except for the two mindless states, sleep, and fainting.

original: de la 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du shes med pa pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang 'gog pa'o //
translated: Among these, the state of non-perception is the cessation of mind and mental factors that occurs when one is born among the gods who are non-perceptive beings.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: The two meditative attainments are:

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: the meditative attainment of non-perception and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs parüîΩldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams gang 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams gang 'gog pa ste /
translated: due to the attention that precedes it, which is free from attachment to the third absorption but not free from attachment to higher levels and is directed toward nondiscernment.

original: de ni 'dir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: 'dis 'gog par 'gyur bas 'gog pa'o //üîΩde yang yid @164a * //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog par 'gyur bas 'gog pa'o // de yang yid @164a * //
translated: It is a meditative attainment because it causes cessation.üîΩIt is a meditative attainment because it causes the cessation of the mental consciousness and its concomitant states.üîΩIt is a meditative attainment because it causes the cessation of the mental consciousness and its concomitant states.üîΩIt is a meditative attainment because it causes the cessation of the mental consciousness and its concomitant states.

analyzed: kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i mi 'byung bar 'gog pa ste / gnas kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag go //
translated: It is a meditative attainment because it causes the cessation of the mental consciousness and its concomitant states.üîΩIt is a meditative attainment because it causes the cessation of original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs ba can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa gang 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs ba can gyi yid mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa gang 'gog pa ste /

original: 'di yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du gnas kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la gdags so //
analyzed: 'di yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du gnas kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la gdags so //

translated: Sleep without mind is called ‚Äúwithout mind‚Äù because for that period of time the mental consciousness does not occur due to being overcome by the heaviness of abiding.

original: sems med pa'i brgyal ba ni glo bur du snang ba dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan ma mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems med pa'i brgyal ba ni glo bur du snang ba dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan ma mnyam pa ste /
translated: Fainting without mind is the sudden appearance of an imbalance of wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: gnas ma mnyam pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa gang yin pa de la sems med pa'i brgyal ba zhes nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: gnas ma mnyam pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa gang yin pa de la sems med pa'i brgyal ba zhes nye bar 'dogs so //

original: gnas skabs lnga po de dag las ma gtogs pa de ma yin pa'i dus thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs lnga po de dag las ma gtogs pa de ma yin pa'i dus thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mental consciousness occurs at all times except during these five states.

original: de ltar 'du shes med pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa 'gags te med par gyur pa de phyis ci las 'byung na gang gi phyir de dag 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /

translated: If the mental consciousness ceases and does not exist in the states of non-perception, etc., from what does it arise later? Why do those beings not die when they emerge from those states?

original: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: It arises from the store consciousness.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon can no //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon can no //
translated: That is because the store consciousness contains the seeds of all the consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gang la bdag dang chos nye bar 'dogs pa de rnam pa gsum du bstan brgya cher rnam pa gsum du bshad zin to /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa gang la bdag dang chos nye bar 'dogs pa de rnam pa gsum du bstan brgya cher rnam pa gsum du bshad zin to /
translated: The transformation of consciousness in which the self and dharmas are imagined has been explained in three parts.

original: // / da ni bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: // / da ni bdag dang chos su nye bar 'dogs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa gyur ba nyid de /

original: rnam par shes pa gyur ba las gud na bdag dang chos med do zhes gang dam bcas pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur ba las gud na bdag dang chos med do zhes gang dam bcas pa de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no self or phenomena apart from the transformation of consciousness, in order to establish that thesis,üîΩthis verse was stated:

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa 'di //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa 'di //
translated: This transformation of consciousness

original: rnam rtog yin te de yis gang //
analyzed: rnam rtog yin te de yis gang //

analyzed: rnam pa rtags de med des na @164b 'dis // thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam //
translated: does not exist. Therefore, all this

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: is perception-only.

original: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam gsum bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam gsum bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The three transformations of consciousness that were just explained are imagination.

original: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don gyi rnam pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The form of the object of superimposition, the mind and mental factors of the three realms, are called imagination.

original: ji skad du ;üîΩyang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: ji skad du ; yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: As it was explained:üîΩUnreal imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa des gang rnam par brtags pa snod dang / bdag dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa des gang rnam par brtags pa snod dang / bdag dang /
translated: The objects that are conceptualized by those forms of consciousness‚Äîthe world, the self,

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag med pas /üîΩde'i phyir rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag med pas / de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gyur pa rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the aggregates, the constituents, the sense fields, form, sound, and so on‚Äîdo not exist.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is said to be conceptualization because it lacks an objective referent.

original: de'i dmigs pa de med par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa de med par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that the objective referent does not exist?

original: gang gi rgyu gang yin pa de tshogs pa dang 'gal ba yang med na de 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu gang yin pa de tshogs pa dang 'gal ba yang med na de 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the cause of something is not opposed to its assemblage, it will arise,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam dang rab rib la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa la yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam dang rab rib la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa la yang 'byung ngo //
translated: Consciousness arises even without an objective referent, as in the case of a magical creation, a phantom city, a dream, an eye disease, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gal te dmigs pa'i khar las na ni de lta na go sgyu ma la sogs pa dag la don med pas rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gal te dmigs pa'i khar las na ni de lta na go sgyu ma la sogs pa dag la don med pas rnam par shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the arising of consciousness were dependent on an objective referent, then consciousness would not arise in the case of a magical creation, etc., since there is no object there.

original: de bas na snga ma 'gags pa de dang rigs gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na snga ma 'gags pa de dang rigs gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, consciousness arises from a consciousness of the same kind, even when the former has ceased.

original: de med kyang phyi rol gyi don las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de med kyang phyi rol gyi don las ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from an external object, even when the latter is present.

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa las rtog par byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par shes par mthong ste /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa las rtog par byed pa rnams phan tshun mi mthun par shes par mthong ste /
translated: And it is seen that those who imagine that there is no difference in meaning have mutually contradictory ideas about it.

original: gcig ni phan tshun mi mthun pa du ma'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig ni phan tshun mi mthun pa du ma'i bdag nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for one thing to have a nature that is mutually contradictory in many ways.

original: de bas na sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med par shes par bya'o//
analyzed: de bas na sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med par shes par bya'o//
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the objective referent of conceptualization does not exist, because it is a superimposed entity.

original: 'dis ni re zhig sgro btags pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni re zhig sgro btags pa'i mtha' spangs nas /
translated: Having thus eliminated the extreme of superimposition,

original: skur ba'i mtha' spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: skur ba'i mtha' spang bar 'dod pas /

original: des na 'di thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des na 'di thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba smos so //

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de bas na'o //
