original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid rnam par rtog pas gang rnam par rtog pa de med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid rnam par rtog pas gang rnam par rtog pa de med de /
translated: Since it is the nature of conceptualization to conceptualize, it does not exist.

original: de bas @165a * //
analyzed: de bas @165a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na yul med pas thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: na yul med pas thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: since there is no object, all this is consciousness only.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni khams gsum pa dang / 'dus ma byas so //üîΩtsam gyi sgra ni de las lhag pa'i yul gcad pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni khams gsum pa dang / 'dus ma byas so // tsam gyi sgra ni de las lhag pa'i yul gcad pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú All this‚Äù means the three realms and unconditioned phenomena.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that it eliminates any object beyond that.

original: pa ni rtsa ba bskang ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni rtsa ba bskang ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is a continuation of the root text.

original: gal te thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam kho na ste /
translated: If all this is consciousness only,

original: de las gzhan byed pa po dang / byed pa med na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes par byin gyis brlabs pa las byed pa med par rnam par rtog pa rnams ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: de las gzhan byed pa po dang / byed pa med na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes par byin gyis brlabs pa las byed pa med par rnam par rtog pa rnams ji ltar 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: and there is no agent or action apart from that, how do the conceptualizations arise without an agent, from the blessing of the fundamental consciousness?

original: de'i phyir / rnam shes sa bon thams cad pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam shes sa bon thams cad pa //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of everything.

original: phan tshun dag gi dbang gis ni //
analyzed: phan tshun dag gi dbang gis ni //
translated: By the power of mutual influence,

original: de lta de ltar 'gyur bar 'gro //
analyzed: de lta de ltar 'gyur bar 'gro //
translated: it goes to transformation in such and such a way.

original: des na rnam rtog de de skye //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: des na rnam rtog de de skye // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, that conceptualization arises.

original: de la chos thams cad skye nus pa dang ldan pas sa bon thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad skye nus pa dang ldan pas sa bon thams cad pa'o //
translated: In this regard, it is the seed of everything because it possesses the ability to generate all things.

original: rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the store consciousness.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa ma yin pa'ang yod pas sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since there is a consciousness that is not the seed of everything, it is said to be the seed of everything.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa la yang kha cig sa bon thams cad bar rtog pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa la yang kha cig sa bon thams cad bar rtog pas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since some imagine that the seed of everything is not consciousness, it is said to be consciousness.

original: yang na tshig gcig la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir bye brag dang / bye brag gi gzhi bstan te /
analyzed: yang na tshig gcig la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir bye brag dang / bye brag gi gzhi bstan te /
translated: Or, since there is error in a single word, the specific and the general are taught.

original: de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: phan tshun dag gi dbang gis na //
analyzed: phan tshun dag gi dbang gis na //
translated: By the power of mutual influence,

analyzed: de lta de ltar 'gyur bar 'gro //
translated: it goes to transformation in such and such a way.

original: zhes bya ba la kun gzhi snga ma'i gnas skabs las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la kun gzhi snga ma'i gnas skabs las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúChange‚Äù means that the alaya is different from its previous state.

original: de lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i 'og ma skyed nus pa'i gnas skabs 'thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i 'og ma skyed nus pa'i gnas skabs 'thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means that it attains a state capable of producing the next conceptualization.

original: phan tshun dbang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun dbang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúMutually dominant‚Äù means

analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rang gi nus pa yongs su gso ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nus pa khyad par can 'gyur ba'i rgyu'o //

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba de yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar phan tshun gyi dbang gis so //

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis byin gyis ma brlabs pa las rnam par rtog pa rnam pa du ma dang de skye'o //
translated: from the alaya consciousness, which is not empowered by another, many kinds of conceptualization arise.

original: 'di ni da ltar gyi tshe la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung ba de bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar gyi tshe la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung ba de bstan to //
translated: This shows how the consciousnesses that engage objects arise from the consciousness that is the basis of all in the present life.

original: da ni rnam par rig pa tsam la da ltar gyi tshe @165b 'gags nas ma 'ongs pa'i tshe ji ltar mtshams sbyar ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig pa tsam la da ltar gyi tshe @165b 'gags nas ma 'ongs pa'i tshe ji ltar mtshams sbyar ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show how the present life ceases and the future life is connected in mere representations, he says:

original: las kyi bag chags 'dzin gnyis kyi //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags 'dzin gnyis kyi //
translated: The latent tendencies of action and the two apprehensions

original: bag chags bcas pa snga ma yi //üîΩrnam par smin pa zad nas kyang //
analyzed: bag chags bcas pa snga ma yi // rnam par smin pa zad nas kyang //
translated: are the prior ones,üîΩand when the prior ones

original: rnam smin skyed pa de yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam smin skyed pa de yin no // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: are exhausted, they produce the result.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sems pa ni las te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i sems pa ni las te /
translated: Meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable volitions are action.

original: las des ma 'ongs pa'i lus mngon bar 'grub bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa skyed pa'i gang yin pa de ni las kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: las des ma 'ongs pa'i lus mngon bar 'grub bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nus pa skyed pa'i gang yin pa de ni las kyi bag chags so //
translated: The latent tendency of action is that which produces the capacity in the consciousness that is the basis of all to actualize the future body by means of that action.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis ni gzung bar 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis ni gzung bar 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The two apprehensions are the apprehension of the apprehended and the apprehension of the apprehender.

original: de la rnam par shes pa las gud na rang yod pas gnas pa'i gzung ba yod par lhag par chags pa ni gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa las gud na rang yod pas gnas pa'i gzung ba yod par lhag par chags pa ni gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The attachment to the existence of an apprehended object that is separate from consciousness and that exists by itself is the attachment to the apprehended object.

original: de yang rnam par shes pas rtogs shing rnam par shes te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pas rtogs shing rnam par shes te /
translated: Moreover, that is understood and cognized by consciousness.

original: 'dzin par nges pa gang yin pa de 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par nges pa gang yin pa de 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The certainty of grasping is the attachment to the apprehending subject.

original: sngon byung ba'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i 'dzin pas brtags pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i de'i rigs kyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa 'byung ba'i sa bon ni 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i 'dzin pas brtags pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i de'i rigs kyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i 'dzin pa 'byung ba'i sa bon ni 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags so //
translated: The seed of the future arising of the attachment to the apprehended object and the attachment to the apprehending subject, which are imagined by the attachment to the apprehended object and the attachment to the apprehending subject that have already occurred, is the twofold latent tendency of attachment.

original: de la las kyi bag chags kyi bye brag gis 'gro ba tha dad pas lus mi 'dra bar gyur pa ni sa bon tha dad pa myu gu tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la las kyi bag chags kyi bye brag gis 'gro ba tha dad pas lus mi 'dra bar gyur pa ni sa bon tha dad pa myu gu tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: The difference in bodies due to the difference in destinies caused by the difference in the latent tendencies of karma is like the difference in sprouts caused by the difference in seeds.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags ni las kyi bag chags thams cad ji ltar rang gis 'phangs pa lus skyed pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi lhag cig byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags ni las kyi bag chags thams cad ji ltar rang gis 'phangs pa lus skyed pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi lhag cig byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The latent impressions of the two graspings are the remainder of all the latent impressions of karma, which are engaged in generating the body in accordance with how they were projected.

original: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu skye ba na chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu skye ba na chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like water, etc. when a sprout is generated from a seed.

original: de lta na las kyi bag chags 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na las kyi bag chags 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is not just the latent impressions of karma.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags kyis zin pas rnam par smin pa skyed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags kyis zin pas rnam par smin pa skyed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that the latent impressions of the two graspings are grasped, and thus they generate karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags dang bcas pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa gnyis kyi bag chags dang bcas pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äútogether with the latent impressions of the two graspings.‚ÄùüîΩThe former

original: snga ma'i / rnam par smin pa zad nas gzhan //
analyzed: snga ma'i / rnam par smin pa zad nas gzhan //
translated: having exhausted its karmic maturation, another

original: rnam smin skyed pa de yin no //
analyzed: rnam smin skyed pa de yin no //
translated: generates karmic maturation.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i las kyis 'dir rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de zad ces bya ba 'phangs pa'i dus kyi mtha' la gnas pa la las kyi bag chags kyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du de 'dzin
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe snga ma la bsags pa'i las kyis 'dir rnam par smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de zad ces bya ba 'phangs pa'i dus kyi mtha' la gnas pa la las kyi bag chags kyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du de 'dzin
translated: The power of the latent impressions of karma that is projected at the end of the time of the result, which is the end of life, holds the result.

original: pa gnyis kyi bag chags dang bcas pas rnam par smin pa spyad zin pa las rnam par smin pa gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de @166a * //üîΩnyid skyed de /
analyzed: pa gnyis kyi bag chags dang bcas pas rnam par smin pa spyad zin pa las rnam par smin pa gzhan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de @166a * // nyid skyed de /
translated: The other result of the exhausted result arises from the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par rnam par smin pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par rnam par smin pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other result apart from the foundation consciousness.

original: snga ma'i rnam par smin pa zad nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtag pa'i mtha' spong ngo //
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam par smin pa zad nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtag pa'i mtha' spong ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen the previous result is exhausted‚Äù eliminates the extreme of eternalism.

original: rnam par smin pa gzhan skyed do zhes bya bas ni chad pa'i mtha' spong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gzhan skyed do zhes bya bas ni chad pa'i mtha' spong ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe other result arises‚Äù eliminates the extreme of nihilism.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod de /
translated: The foundation consciousness exists apart from the consciousnesses such as visual consciousness.

original: de nyid sa bon thams cad pa ste /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid sa bon thams cad pa ste / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is the seed of all things.üîΩIt is not the eye consciousness, etc.

original: lung dang rigs pas yod par mngon te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas yod par mngon te /
translated: How is this known? It is known through scripture and reasoning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa las /
translated: The Lord Buddha has said in the Abhidharma:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
translated: The realm of beginningless time

original: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: is the abode of all phenomena.üîΩBecause it exists, all beings

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and even nirvana are attained.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'khor bar 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'khor bar 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, it would be impossible for beings to enter samsara and impossible for them to leave it.

original: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa ni ris mthun pa gzhan dag tu nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: To enter samsara means to be reborn in other similar classes of beings.

original: ldog pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: ldog pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: To leave samsara means to attain nirvana, either with or without remainder.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par mi rung ste /
translated: Apart from the storehouse consciousness, consciousness cannot be the condition for formative forces, because

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'ang med par 'gyur ro //üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa med na 'jug pa'ang med par 'gyur ro // kun gzhi rnam par shes pa khas mi len na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: if consciousness were not the condition for formative forces, then there would be no entry into rebirth.

original: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag 'du byed kyi rkyen las 'byung bar brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag 'du byed kyi rkyen las 'byung bar brtag grang na /
translated: If one does not accept the storehouse consciousness, then the consciousness that links rebirth or the six consciousnesses that are perfumed by formative forces would be the consciousness that is the condition for formative forces.

original: de la 'du byed gang yin pa dag ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de la 'du byed gang yin pa dag ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod de /
translated: But this is not so, because the formative forces cannot be the condition for the consciousness that links rebirth.

original: de dag ni 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the formative forces have long since ceased to exist.

original: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that which has ceased does not exist.

original: med pa ni rkyen du mi rung bas 'du byed ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med pa ni rkyen du mi rung bas 'du byed ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du mi rung ngo //
translated: And that which does not exist cannot be a condition. Therefore, the formative forces cannot be the condition for the consciousness that links rebirth.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na ming dang gzugs kyang yod de /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na ming dang gzugs kyang yod de /
translated: Name and form also exist at the time of linking up,

original: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na de la rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung gi / ming dang gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na de la rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung gi / ming dang gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
translated: but consciousness alone does not exist. What logic is there in saying that consciousness alone arises due to the condition of karmic formation and not name and form?

original: de lta @166b bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta @166b bas na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, you should say that name and form are due to the condition of karmic formation,

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: but consciousness is not.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúName and form are due to the condition of consciousness‚Äù?

original: gal te dus phyi ma pa gang yin pa'i rkyen no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dus phyi ma pa gang yin pa'i rkyen no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the condition of the future,

original: de nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i ming dang gzugs las rang bzhin bye brag tu 'gyur ba ci yod na /
analyzed: de nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i ming dang gzugs las rang bzhin bye brag tu 'gyur ba ci yod na /
translated: then what is the difference between that and the name and form of linking up?

original: 'di ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba yin la snga ma ni ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba yin la snga ma ni ma yin /
translated: In that case, it is due to the condition of consciousness alone, but not the former.

original: snga ma ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba yin la phyi ma ni ma yin /
analyzed: snga ma ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung ba yin la phyi ma ni ma yin /
translated: The former is conditioned by the formative forces, but the latter is not.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, name and form are conditioned by the formative forces,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yan lag gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa yan lag gzhan kun du brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: but what purpose is served by postulating the other link of the ‚Äòlinking consciousness‚Äô?

original: de lta bas na nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the ‚Äòlinking consciousness‚Äô is not tenable as being conditioned by the formative forces.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa dag kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa dag kyang 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: Also, the sixfold collection of consciousness, which is infused by the formative forces, is not tenable as being conditioned by the formative forces.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bdag la skye mi nus te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par smin pa'i bag chags dang / rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags bdag la skye mi nus te /
translated: Consciousness is unable to generate the latent impressions of karmic maturation and the latent impressions of the cause of natural outflow in itself,

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: mjug thogs su 'byung ba la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mjug thogs su 'byung ba la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that consciousness arises immediately after the formative forces,

original: de'i tshe de ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, it does not exist.

original: ma byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because that which does not exist is nonexistent.

original: byung ba na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byung ba na yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it when it has arisen,

original: de ni de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, it has already ceased.

original: sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems med pa'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na ni 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'byung mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of the attainment of cessation, which is devoid of mind, it is impossible for a mind that is perfumed by formations to arise.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, due to the condition of consciousness, name and form do not exist.

original: de med pa skye mched drug kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa skye mched drug kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to their nonexistence, the six sense bases also do not exist.

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, due to the condition of birth, aging and death do not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the entry into sa·πÉsƒÅra does not exist.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams so //
translated: Thus, due to the condition of ignorance, there are formations.

original: des bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Due to the condition of formations that perfume it, there is consciousness that is the foundation consciousness.

original: de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs de tshul 'di la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs de tshul 'di la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in this method of positing name-and-form at the time of rebirth.

original: 'khor pa ldog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'khor pa ldog pa yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi rung ste /
translated: Also, samsara would not be possible without the foundation consciousness.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so //üîΩde gnyis @167a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams so // de gnyis @167a * //
translated: The cause of samsara is karma and the afflictions.

original: las kyang nyon mongs pa ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: las kyang nyon mongs pa ni gtso bo ste /
translated: Of these two, the afflictions are primary.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis yang sred pa 'phen nus par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩde ltar 'phangs pa'i srid pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yang srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis na las kyis yang sred pa 'phen nus par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // de ltar 'phangs pa'i srid pa yang las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis yang srid par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, due to the power of the afflictions, karma can impel rebirth; it cannot do so otherwise.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, the rebirth that is impelled in this way occurs due to the power of karma and the afflictions; it does not occur otherwise.

original: de ltar na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa nyid 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Thus, because they are primary, the afflictions are the root of entering samsara.

original: de'i phyir de dag spangs nas 'khor ba yang ldog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag spangs nas 'khor ba yang ldog par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, samsara ceases when they are abandoned; it does not cease otherwise.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par de dag spang du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par de dag spang du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to eliminate them without the foundation consciousness.

original: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pa'am /
translated: Are they eliminated when they are manifest?

original: sa bon gyi tshe spong grang na /
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshe spong grang na /
translated: Or are they eliminated when they are seeds?

original: de mngon du gyur pa spong po zhe na ni 'di ni mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de mngon du gyur pa spong po zhe na ni 'di ni mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that they are eliminated when they are manifest, that is unacceptable.

original: de spong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir sa bon gyi tshe spang du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de spong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir sa bon gyi tshe spang du yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible to eliminate them when they are seeds, because you maintain that the path that eliminates them exists when the seeds are present.

original: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de dag gnyen pos spong na de'i tshe na ni gnyen po las gzhan ci yang rung ba ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gnas pa de dag gnyen pos spong na de'i tshe na ni gnyen po las gzhan ci yang rung ba ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the seeds of the afflictions exist in a person, and they are eliminated by an antidote, then at that time, since the antidote is not something other than the seeds, it would not be possible to eliminate them.

original: ji ste gnyen po'i sems nyid nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan par 'dod na ni de nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa nyid pas de'i gnyen por 'gyur ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: ji ste gnyen po'i sems nyid nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan par 'dod na ni de nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa nyid pas de'i gnyen por 'gyur ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: If you assert that the mind that is the antidote is endowed with the seeds of the afflictions, then it would not be logical for it to be the antidote, because it would be endowed with the seeds of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ldog pa mi srid do ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma spangs pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ldog pa mi srid do ;
translated: It is impossible to stop the cycle of sa·πÉsƒÅra without eliminating the seeds of the afflictions.

original: / de lta bas na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang gi sa bon gso bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar khas blang po //
analyzed: / de lta bas na gdon mi za bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rang gi sa bon gso bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags bsgo bar khas blang po //
translated: Therefore, one must admit that the store consciousness is perfumed by the mental consciousness and the other consciousnesses, and that the mental afflictions and secondary mental afflictions that arise together with them perfume the store consciousness in order to nourish their own seeds.

original: bag chags rnams stobs ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa rnyed na rgyur gyur pa'i bye brag thob pa'i sems nyid las nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dag 'byung ba de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam gyis sel to //
analyzed: bag chags rnams stobs ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa rnyed na rgyur gyur pa'i bye brag thob pa'i sems nyid las nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang dag 'byung ba de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa ni de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po lam gyis sel to //
translated: When the perfuming has acquired the power to do so, the seeds of those mental afflictions and secondary mental afflictions that arise from the mind itself, which has become the specific cause, are eliminated by the path that is the antidote to the mental afflictions that arise together with them.

original: de bas na gnas de la yang nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung bas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob po //
analyzed: de bas na gnas de la yang nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung bas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, the mental afflictions do not arise in that basis, and one attains the realm of nirvana that has a remaining support.

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe ni 'gags la de las gzhan pa'i tshe dang ni nying mtshams mi sbyor bas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i @167b dbyings 'thob ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe ni 'gags la de las gzhan pa'i tshe dang ni nying mtshams mi sbyor bas phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i @167b dbyings 'thob ste /
translated: Life projected by former karma ceases, and since it does not link with another life, one attains the expanse of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: las yod du zin kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: las yod du zin kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed mi nus so //

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog par 'gyur gyi /

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa las gud na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod la de nyid chos thams cad kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ste /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin par gdon mi za bar khas blang par bya'o //

analyzed: mdo sde dag las ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa dang ngo bo nyid gsum gsungs so zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag par 'gal ba med do //

original: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir //

original: rnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags pa //

analyzed: tha na sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du yang de nyid kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de 'dir gtan tshigs smos pa ni /

analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gcig dang de med pa la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa du ma 'jug pa ma mthong ste /

original: dngos po gcig pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po gcig pa'am /

analyzed: de bas na 'di dag thams cad rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid de /

analyzed: don de kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // mdo sde las kyang rab 'byor ji ltar @168a * //

original: zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe dependent nature is conceptualization, arising from conditions.

analyzed: gzhan gyi dang bshad zin to /

original: de'i phyir / grub ni de la snga ma po //

translated: The perfected is the former‚Äôs

analyzed: snga ma po zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa nyid do //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por kun brtags pa ste /

analyzed: gzhan min gzhan pa min pa min //

original: yongs su grub pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi chos nyid de de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang las yongs su grub pa gzhan pa yang ma yin la gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin par khong du chud par bya'o //

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal spong zhing rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la yang sems gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal spong zhing rang gi sems kyi chos nyid la yang sems gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the mind abides in the reality of the mind, because the latent impressions of the adherence to the grasped and grasper are eliminated.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la sems gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the mind abides in mere representation in this way, then at that time,

original: ji skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bya zhe na /
translated: what is it called?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de ni sems med mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni sems med mi dmigs pa //
translated: It is the absence of mind, the non-apprehension,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes de //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes de //
translated: of that supramundane wisdom,

original: gnas kyang gzhan du gyur pa ste //
analyzed: gnas kyang gzhan du gyur pa ste //
translated: the transformation of the basis,

original: gnas ngan len gnyis spangs pas so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gnyis spangs pas so //
translated: because the two kinds of negative reflex actions are eliminated.

original: de nyid zag pa med dang dbyings //
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med dang dbyings //
translated: It is the uncontaminated realm,

original: bsam mi khyab dang dge dang bstan //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang dge dang bstan //
translated: the inconceivable, the virtuous, and the revealed.

original: de ni bde ba rnam grol @171a * //
analyzed: de ni bde ba rnam grol @171a * //
translated: It is bliss, liberation,

original: sku ; / thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //
analyzed: sku ; / thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //
translated: and the body, called the Dharma of the Great Sage.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mthong ba'i lam la brten te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mthong ba'i lam la brten te /
translated: These two verses are about the path of seeing of the yogi who has entered into the mere representation.

original: gong nas gong du bye brag tu 'gro bas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gong nas gong du bye brag tu 'gro bas 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: These two verses demonstrate the perfection of result, based on the path of seeing of the yogi who has entered into mere representation, by his going higher and higher.

original: de la 'dzin pa'i sems med pa dang / gzung ba'i don mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa'i sems med pa dang / gzung ba'i don mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no mind of grasping and no perception of an object of grasping,

original: de ni sems med mi dmigs pa //üîΩzhes bya'o // 'jig rten na 'dris par ma byas pa dang kun du 'byung ba med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten las rgal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni sems med mi dmigs pa // zhes bya'o // 'jig rten na 'dris par ma byas pa dang kun du 'byung ba med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten las rgal ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said to be ‚Äúwithout mind and without perception.‚ÄùüîΩBecause it is not familiar in the world, because it does not arise in the world, because it is nonconceptual, and because it transcends the world,

original: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes de //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i ye shes de //
translated: it is said to be ‚Äútransmundane gnosis.‚Äù

original: zhes bya'o // ye shes de'i 'og tu gnas gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgnas kyang gzhan du gyur pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ye shes de'i 'og tu gnas gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir / gnas kyang gzhan du gyur pa ste //
translated: In order to demonstrate the transformation of the basis that is subsequent to that gnosis,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe basis is also transformed.‚Äù

original: gnas ni 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ni 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa'o //
translated: The basis here is the fundamental consciousness, which is the seed of everything.

original: de gyur pa ni gang gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa dang / gnyis kyi bag chags kyi dngos po log na las su rung ba dang / chos kyi sku dang / mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi dngos por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de gyur pa ni gang gnas ngan len dang / rnam par smin pa dang / gnyis kyi bag chags kyi dngos po log na las su rung ba dang / chos kyi sku dang / mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: That transformation is the reversal of the entities of the two kinds of habitual tendencies of negative reflex actions and of karmic maturation, and the attainment of the entities of flexibility, the Dharma body, and nondual intuition.

original: gnas gyur pa de yang gang spangs pas thob par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / gnas ngan len gnyis spangs pas so //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa de yang gang spangs pas thob par 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / gnas ngan len gnyis spangs pas so //
translated: What is abandoned in order to attain that transformation?

original: zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBy abandoning the two kinds of negative reflex actions.‚Äù

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The two are the negative reflex actions of the obstacle of the passions and the negative reflex actions of the obstacle to that which is to be known.

original: gnas ngan len ni gnas las su mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni gnas las su mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: Negative reflex action is the unfitness of the basis.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon no //
translated: And that is the seed of the obstacles of the passions and of the knowable.

original: gnas gyur pa de yang nyan thos la sogs pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs pas thob par 'gyur ba ni gang /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa de yang nyan thos la sogs pa la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs pas thob par 'gyur ba ni gang /
translated: What is that transformation that is attained by abandoning the negative reflex actions that are present in the disciples and others?

original: rnam grol sku zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam grol sku zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe body of liberation.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs pas thob par 'gyur ba ni gang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la yod pa'i gnas ngan len spangs pas thob par 'gyur ba ni gang /
translated: What is attained by the Bodhisattva through the abandonment of negative reflex actions?

original: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thub pa chen po'i chos zhes bya // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is called the Dharma of the Great Sage.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i bye brag gis gnas gyur ba bla na yod pa dang / bla na med par bstan to //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis spangs pa'i bye brag gis gnas gyur ba bla na yod pa dang / bla na med par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the transformation is with remainder and without remainder, according to the distinction of the abandonment of the two obscurations.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /üîΩlen pa'i rnam shes sgrib gnyis kyi //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa / len pa'i rnam shes sgrib gnyis kyi //
translated: Here is a verse:

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is to be known as the characteristic of the two obscurations.

original: nyon mongs sa bon kun sa bon //
analyzed: nyon mongs sa bon kun sa bon //
translated: The seeds of the afflictions and the seeds of the obscurations of the knowable are the seeds of the two.

original: der ni gnyis la gnyis 'ching ngo //
analyzed: der ni gnyis la gnyis 'ching ngo //
translated: Therein, the two are bound to the two.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos @171b dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos @171b dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The two are the Sravakas and the Bodhisattvas.

original: snga ma la ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: snga ma la ni nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The former have the seeds of the afflictions,

original: cig shos la ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon te /
analyzed: cig shos la ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon te /
translated: and the latter have the seeds of the two obscurations.

original: de dag bcom pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bcom pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the destruction of those, one attains omniscience.

original: de nyid zag pa med dang dbyings //
analyzed: de nyid zag pa med dang dbyings //
translated: It is the uncontaminated realm.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i rang bzhin de nyid zag pa med pa dang dbyings zhes bya ste /üîΩgnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i rang bzhin de nyid zag pa med pa dang dbyings zhes bya ste / gnas ngan len med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the nature of the transformation itself, which is called ‚Äúundefiled‚Äù and ‚Äúelement‚Äù.

original: zag pa thams cad dang bral bas zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa thams cad dang bral bas zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúundefiled‚Äù because it is free from all the defilements.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas dbyings so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas dbyings so //
translated: It is called ‚Äúelement‚Äù because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúelement‚Äù here means cause.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / so so rang gis rig pa dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / so so rang gis rig pa dang / dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is not the domain of speculation, because it is the self-experience of each one for himself, and because it is without example.

original: dge ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i bde ba dang / zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa'i bde ba dang / zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is good because it is the bliss of the object of purification and because it is the nature of the undefiled dharmas.

original: bstan pa ni rtag pa dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni rtag pa dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the teaching because it is eternal and inexhaustible.

original: bde ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is bliss because it is eternal.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: 'di ni rtag pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa ste ;
translated: This is eternal.

original: de'i phyir bde ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is bliss.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas nyan thos rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'o //
translated: The liberation body of the sravakas is due to the elimination of the afflictive obstructions.

original: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de ni thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de ni thub pa chen po'i chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
translated: That reality transformation is called the reality body of the great sage.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs bas gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa'i phyir thub pa chen po chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs bas gnas gyur pa yang dag par grub pa'i phyir thub pa chen po chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the reality body of the great sage because it is fully achieved through the transformation of the basis by eliminating the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience through the cultivation of the levels and the perfections.

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhing des nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong zhing des nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the reality body of the bodhisattva because it is not a relinquishing of cyclic existence, because it is free of afflictions, and because it attains mastery over all phenomena.

original: thub pa chen po zhes bya ba ni thub pa'i mchog dang ldan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni thub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: thub pa chen po zhes bya ba ni thub pa'i mchog dang ldan pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni thub pa chen po'o //
translated: The great sage is the Buddha Bhagavan, because he possesses the supreme sage.

original: sum cu pa'i bshad pa slob dpon blo brtan gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sum cu pa'i bshad pa slob dpon blo brtan gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the thirty verses by master Sthiramati is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian scholars Jinamitra and Surendrabodhi and the chief editor, the Venerable Translator Yeshe De, revised and finalized the translation.
